course.dc:subject: watersports water sports BCU paddlesport coaching
Leisure & WatersportsLeisure & Watersports
course.dc:title: Coaching Paddlesport BCU Certificate Level 1
course.abstract: Training in teaching techniques afloat and ashore is provided during the instructor training course.
course.learningOutcome: When qualified as an instructor you will be eligible to work for outdoor centres both in the UK and worldwide. You will be qualified to teach beginners in all aspects of the sport.
course.mlo:objective:
UKCC paddlesport coach Level 1

This is the first step on the paddlesport coaching pathway. It will introduce you to the fundamentals of good coaching practice and help you to understand and coach technical and tactical aspects of your sport. This course is for anyone interested and involved in paddlesport! If you want to encourage others into paddlesport or help existing paddlers to improve their skills then this is the award for you. You could be someone with family members involved in paddlesport, someone wanting a career instructing in the outdoor industry, or an experienced paddler wanting to move into coaching. As the award is either bank-based or boat-based it is accessible for anyone interested in coaching paddlesport. You can assist higher level Coaches, delivering coaching sessions under their supervision, and deliver taster sessions.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Minimum age 16, valid first aid qualification. Acceptable certificates include the RYA's First Aid Certificate, First Aid at Work, First Aid at Sea, or any other certificate issued on completion of a course which is a minimum of one day's duration, recognised by the Health and Safety Executive and includes the treatment of hypothermia, cold shock and drowning. 

You must also be a member of the national governing body (Royal Yachting Association for windsurfing/dinghy sailing and the British Canoe Union for Paddlesport).

course.dc:description: This course is for anyone who wishes to develop the skills and capabilities required to be able to progress, with confidence, to a further Level 1 or a Level 2 course in a vocational area, or into employment.
course.dc:subject: Level 1 Animal care Horse Care Agriculture Early Years Personal development Horticulture Conservation
Preparation for Life & Work
course.dc:title: Vocational Studies EDEXCEL Certificate Level 1
course.learningOutcome:
Options for progression are to a further course at Level 1 in a specific vocational area, a course at Level 2, an apprenticeship or other employment with training.

 

 

During the year, you will be encouraged to discuss your personal aims and aspirations with a Careers South West adviser and with your personal tutor.
course.mlo:objective:
This is a Foundation Learning programme which combines vocational learning with functional skills in English, Maths and ICT and personal and social development.  You can choose options within a single vocational area or sample from a range of options that could include agriculture, horticulture, conservation, animal care, horse care, sport, early years or public services depending on the campus. You will also work towards a C&G Certificate in Employability and Personal Development to develop the skills and qualities that employers look for.

During the year you will take part in many enrichment activities designed to improve confidence, team working skills and communication skills.  There are opportunities to take part in volunteering in the community, sport and outdoor education, fund raising activities, team building and problem solving.  You will also work on independent living skills such as cooking and personal finance.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
There are no formal entry requirements but you will be asked to attend an interview and encouraged to come for a taster course.

You can start in September, January or April.

course.dc:title: Culinary Chef CG Diploma Level 2
course.abstract: This is an ideal course for those looking for a first step into the Hotel and Catering industry
course.learningOutcome: Upon successful completion of this course, you can enter employment as a Chef or you can continue onto a Level 3 programme at the college.
course.mlo:objective: You will learn the Principles of food preparation and cooking, become skilled in such important skills as frying, baking, grilling, poaching, steaming and griddling and you will learn how to prepare and cook a variety of interesting and exciting dishes including meats, fish, sauces, soups, vegetables, salads, pastries, and hot and cold desserts. You will also undertake Functional skills, ERR, CIEH food safety award, Sustainability in Professional Kitchens, Introduction into foraging and wild food, Allergen awareness, safety and hygiene in the kitchen and the importance of teamwork in cooking for our busy restaurant.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements although you will need to show a strong commitment to pursuing a career in food preparation and cookery and have literacy and numeracy skills to Level 1 or above. All applicants for will be required to attend an interview and assessment.  If you are at all unsure as to your suitability for the course we will discuss each individual at an arranged interview. Please contact the college and the programme manager will be happy to discuss the course and its content with you.

course.dc:title: Hospitality Supervision and Leadership CG NVQ Diploma Level 3
course.mlo:objective:
The Qualification is made up of a number of units, each with a credit value (these units will be either Mandatory and some Optional). You will need to have 37 Credits in total.

You will also be assigned an assessor for this course who will come and visit you as much as possible to complete the course. While on the course there will be many different assessment methods, which include:

  • Observations by the assessor
  • Products of your own work
  • Projects and assignments
  • Questioning
  • Peer Reports
  • Witness Testimonies
  • Professional Discussion
course.mlo:prerequisite: You will need to be in a Supervisory role within the Hospitality and Catering industry, and have good knowledge of the area you are responsible for.

course.dc:description:
If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

There are no apprenticeship course fees charged for anyone between the ages of 16 and 18.  For those aged 19 and over, fees do apply.

Contact us for more information.

Ideal if: you want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised advanced qualification

You'll need: to have previously completed a level 2 apprenticeship or have relevant experience

You'll learn: the complex aspects of site work or bench joinery

Expect: to put together a portfolio of evidence to show your practical competence

You'll love: receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors

You'll go onto: employment, or more studies at level 4 or higher
course.dc:subject: Wood occupations, carpentry, joinery, timber, apprenticeship, carpenter, construction, cabinet making, city and guilds
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Carpentry and Joinery Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised advanced qualification
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a qualified site carpenter or bench joiner.

If you work for a large company, you may work as a planner and estimator, designer, production controller or specialist craftsperson. Alternatively, you could start your own business or teach wood occupations.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, wood machining or furniture making apprenticeship.

The full time BTEC Diploma in Construction and Built Environment or the FdSc Sustainable Construction course may interest to you, both are offered at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 or 2 days per week for 1 year, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will learn the complex aspects of site work or bench joinery.  The site carpentry course covers complex roofing, geometry and site operations; while the bench joinery course covers complex curved work.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • NVQ Diploma in Wood Occupations (Construction)
  • Level 3 Diploma in Site Carpentry or Bench Joinery
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a suitable position.

You must have completed the Level 2 Carpentry and Joinery Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

presentation.dc:subject: Construction Trades
presentation.dc:title: Carpentry and Joinery Apprenticeship Level 3

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want a career in boatbuilding; painting, varnishing and sculpting the inside and outside of world class super yachts.

You must have good practical skills, be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Marine Surface Finishing Apprenticeship, and supports those working in a junior marine craftsperson or technicians position.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, marine, yacht, surface, finishing, painting, boatbuilding, rigging, sheet metalwork, marine surface finishing
Conservation, Zoology and Animal Behaviour
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Marine Surface Finishing Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Certificate, you are a fully qualified marine craftsperson and could work as a boat builder, marine surface finisher or a marine maintenance technician. In the future, you could progress to the level of a supervisor, technical manager, programme manager or programme director within the boatbuilding industry.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in the team leading, people management, carpentry and joinery or engineering apprenticeship through Cornwall College Business. Alternatively you may be interested in the full time FdSc Boat Design and Production course, which is offered at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your level 2 certificate and have the opportunity to select a pathway to suit your job e.g. electrical installation and maintenance, mechanical installation and maintenance, sheet metalwork, manual welding, rigging, surface preparation and yacht painting.

You may prepare and finish a variety of tasks within the project from hand grips and marine engines to repairing hulls of boats and carbon fibre masts; you will develop thorough knowledge in boatbuilding and gain valuable experience. You may even see your yacht launched!

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving  support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 NVQ Marine Engineering
  • Level 3 Certificate in Boatbuilding, Maintenance and Support
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

You must have completed the Level 2 Marine Surface Finishing Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools.

You must enjoy working with children and young adults, be confident in the classroom environment and have sufficient language, literacy and numeracy skills.
course.dc:subject: teaching teachers learning school apprenticeship support level 3
Early Years
course.dc:title: School Support Staff Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 qualification in Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools, you could work in a variety of job roles within the education sector, eg teaching assistant, learning support assistants, special needs, behaviour support coordinators, welfare support, cover supervisors, learning guide/coach or exam invigilation assistant.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol in an FdA Children and Young Peoples Workforce followed by a CertEd/PGCE, BSc (Hons) Combined Social Science or a BSc (Hons) Health and Social Care. Thereafter, you may find yourself working as a teacher, early years practitioner, early years manager, further education lecturer, adult education tutor, care worker, volunteer, social care worker or SEN teacher.
course.mlo:objective:
During this apprenticeship, you will attend classes at one of our campuses, one day per week, for 12 months.

The main areas of teaching in class include promoting positive behaviour, supporting learning assessment and activities, understanding development and safeguarding of children and young people.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 in Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and have a minimum of level 1 literacy, numeracy and ICT skills. You must be employed within a suitable position in the teaching sector for a minimum of 16 hours a week.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and become fully qualified in vehicle body and paint operations.

You must enjoy working in the motor vehicle industry, have good practical skills and have a good eye to assess damage.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Vehicle Body and Paint Apprenticeship, and supports those working as a trainee body repair technician or a trainee body finishing technician.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, body and paint, automative, vehicles, motor vehicles, mechanical
Motor Vehicle
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Vehicle Body and Paint Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a qualified vehicle body and paint operations technician and could work as body repair technician, body finishing technician, start your own business or teach.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, vehicle maintenance and repair or vehicle parts and operations apprenticeship.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place.

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your level 2 certificate and have the opportunity to select a pathway to suit your job. You will choose from the following:

  • Body repair - remove, repair and replace body panels, realign the vehicle and check the body repairs
  • Paint refinishing - carry out refinishing operations, mix and match paint, and identify and repair paint defects on the vehicle

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 Diploma in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
  • NVQ in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C level and be employed in a suitable trainee position.

You must have completed the Level 2 Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a qualified motor vehicle maintenance and repair technician and could work as a vehicle technician, auto electrician, MOT Tester, start your own business or teach.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, vehicle body and paint operations or vehicle parts and operations apprenticeship.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your level 2 certificate and continue in your selected pathway e.g. light vehicles, motorcycles or heavy vehicles.  You will identify and repair complex faults in the vehicle engine, transmission and driveline system, auxiliary electrical units and chassis system.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will have awarded following qualifications:

  • Level 3 Diploma in Vehicle Maintenance and Repair
  • NVQ in Vehicle Maintenance and Repair

You must enjoy working in the motor vehicle industry, and have good customer service and administrative skills.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Vehicle Parts and Operations, and supports those working as a junior vehicle parts operative.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, automotive, vehicles, parts, motor vehicle, engineering, vihicle parts, vihicle operations
Motor Vehicle Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Vehicle Parts and Operations Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a fully qualified vehicle parts operative or parts advisor, and can advise and sell parts and accessories for motor vehicles, motorcycles, truck and coaches.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in a team leading, people management, vehicle body and paint operations or vehicle maintenance and repair apprenticeship.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will build on your Level 2 Diploma and have the opportunity to select units to suit your job role. You will learn to process payment transactions, resolve customer service issues and coordinate stocktaking. You may find yourself in a more senior role where you are responsible for planning, monitoring and adjusting staffing levels and schedules; or communicating with customers electronically.

The customer base will vary and may include large dealerships, small garages and members of the public. You will develop good customer service skills, while helping your company maximise sales through providing an excellent customer experience.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 Diploma in Vehicle Parts Operations
  • NVQ in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C level and be employed in a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

You must have completed the Level 2 Vehicle Parts and Operations Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

Ideal if: you are a trainee wood machinist and wish to train on the job

You'll learn: the methods of machining complex joinery to produce sawn, planed, profiled, jointed, sanded and bored timber, and how to use CNC machines

Expect: to put together a portfolio of evidence to show your skills

You'll love: working in our well-equipped workshops and being supported by expert tutors

course.dc:title: Wood Machining Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Advance your wood machining skills.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a qualified to work as a wood machinist, CNC programmer, technician or quality assurance manager; thereafter you could progress to the level of a supervisor or manager. Alternatively, you could work as a designer, teacher or start your own business.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, carpentry or furniture making apprenticeship. The full time BTEC Diploma in Construction and Built Environment or the FdSc Sustainable Construction course may be of interest to you, both are offered by Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 1 year, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will learn the methods of machining complex joinery. You will produce sawn, planed, profiled, jointed, sanded and bored timber, and timber based products using CNC/NC machines.

Depending on your job role and industry, you may have the opportunity to work on a variety of products e.g. desks, doors, stairs or floorboards.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • NVQ Diploma in Wood Machining (Construction/Sawmilling)
  • Level 3  Diploma in Wood Machining QCF
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a suitable position.

You must have completed the Level 2 Wood Machining Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become fully qualified in marine engineering; while laying the foundation for a career in building, fitting out, finishing or maintaining boats.

You must have good practical and hand skills, be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Marine Engineering Apprenticeship, and supports a variety of positions e.g. boat builder, carpenter, marine electrics and marine engineer.

Engineering
course.dc:title: Marine Engineering Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become fully qualified in marine engineering
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Marine Engineering Diploma, you are qualified to the level of a craftsperson or technician.

In the future, you could work as a designer, fitter, operator, project manager or programme director. This course could take you in a variety of directions.

You may be interested in studying further and complete a Diploma in Engineering Leadership, Diploma in Business Improvement, Diploma in People Management, FdSc Engineering, HNC Engineering or an BSc(Hons) Mechanical Design and Manufacture.
course.mlo:objective:
You will study on a part time basis and attend lectures at the Falmouth campus 1 day per week for 2 years.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway and units to suit your job. You will build onto your Level 2 Certificate and develop advanced skills by undertaking complex tasks e.g. fitting out of boats, servicing and maintenance of marine engines, principles of marine electrical systems, and producing and repairing hulls and decks.

Depending on your workplace, you may work on variety of boats e.g. ships, tankers, ferry boats, fishing vessels or sporting boats.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Marine Engineering
  • Level 2 BTEC Diploma in Engineering Technology
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

You must have completed the Level 2 Marine Engineering Certificate or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Progression on completion of the apprenticeship could lead to a Foundation Degree in IT.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend workshops over the duration of the apprenticeship in the Cornwall College Digital Academy at St Austell

IT technician (Cisco or Microsoft course available)

Two pathways available

  • Microsoft Server 2012 - you will attend workshops to develop your skills in working with servers

The Microsoft pathway will give you the opportunity of 2 units accredited towards the MCSA (Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate)

  • Software design fundamentals
  • C++ computer programming
  • Software testing

You will be assessed through building a portfolio of evidence, written assignments or exams.

Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Accounting Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in accounting
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you could progress to the AAT Level 4 Diploma.

After completing all 3 levels of the accounting apprenticeship, you could work as an Accounts Clerk, Credit Control Assistant, Finance Assistant or Purchase Ledger Clerk in any type of business or industry e.g. large public sector, small companies, not for profit companies or clubs.

Thereafter you could progress to a full membership of the Association of Accounting Technicians and then complete a professional accounting qualification with a chartered body:

  • CIPFA - The Chartered Institute of Public Finance and Accountancy
  • ACCA - Association of Chartered Certified Accounts
  • CIMA - Chartered Institute of Management Accountants
  • ICAEW - The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales

Alternatively, you may wish to enrol in a management apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business or a full time business related course at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 44 weeks, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will learn more complex finance officer processes e.g. final accounts for sole traders and partnerships, reports and returns, and professional ethics. You will also learn how to use Sage accounting software.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

AAT Level 3 Accounting Diploma
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in the AAT Level 3 Accounting Diploma, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a trainee accounting position. You must have completed an AAT Level 2 Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:subject: Admin, administration, admin assistant, Business foundation degree,business management, management, marketing, planning, post grad, retail business, public services, enterprise, marketing, management, accoutnancy, human resource, business law, business development, venture, employability, leadership, strategy development, business finance, legal, economics, research,
Business, Administration & Law
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Business Administration Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome: Upon successful completion, you can progress onto any of the Business Skills courses offered at Cornwall College at the same or a higher level.
course.mlo:objective:
This course consists of six mandatory units and a range of optional units, to give a minimum of 58 credits in total.  Delivery will consist of class-based and work based learning.  The mandatory units are:

  • Communicate in a business environment
  • Principles of business communication and information
  • Principles of administration
  • Principles of business
  • Manage personal and professional development
  • Understand employer organisations

 You then select the optional units to suit your specific job role, which may include:

  • Contributing to the improvement of business performance
  • Document production
  • Co-ordinating an event / meetings
  • Evaluating and maintain customer service
  • Managing information and data

As part of the apprenticeship framework you are required to complete Functional Skills in English, Maths and ICT at Level 2 unless exemptions are provided.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and be employed in a senior administrative role.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Electrotechnical Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to become a fully qualified electrician while training on the job
course.learningOutcome:
With the above qualifications and certificates, you are a qualified electrician and could work in the following positions:

  • Installation Electrician - installation of power systems, lighting, fire protection, security and structured cabling in a variety of buildings
  • Maintenance Electrician - regular inspection of systems to ensure they are working correctly

You may find yourself working for a large employer and progress to managing projects or clients; or start your own business.

In the future, you may be interested in completing further qualifications e.g. 2391 Test and Inspection, 17th Edition Wiring regulations (2382), Photovoltaic systems, PAT (Portable Appliance Test) Inspection or Introduction to Carbon Management. Thereafter you could progress to a FdSc Carbon Management or FdSc Renewable Energy Technologies, and work on environmentally friendly systems or innovation projects.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus for 42 months. During the first 3 years, you will attend lectures 1 day per week, assessment in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you work under the direction of a qualified electrician. You will learn how to diagnose and correct electrical faults; and install and connect wiring systems, wiring enclosures and equipment. You will be required to complete 2 technical certificates:

  • Inspection
  • Testing and Commissioning Assignment
  • Fault Diagnosis and Rectification Assignment

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 NVQ Electrotechnical Diploma
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 3 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on a cutting course in London, a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship or branch out and enrol in the Barbering Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Hairdressing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs and be employed within a salon environment. You must have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

You need to have completed the Level 2 Hairdressing Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Health and Social Care.

You must have good interpersonal skills, respect for people who use the service, good verbal and non verbal communication skills and a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Health and Social Care Apprenticeship and supports those working in a variety of roles e.g. senior healthcare support worker, senior healthcare assistant, care officer, care supervisor, senior care worker, supervising care worker, senior support worker, relief team leader, social work assistant, social services officer, community outreach/support worker, family support worker or personal assistant.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship healthcare social care health and social acre social work family support

Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Health and Social Care Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you may progress to a more senior position e.g. social care worker, care home manager or other supervisory care positions

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol in the FdA Health and Community Studies, FdSc Healthcare and Practice or FdSc Working with Older Persons followed by a BSc (Hons) Health and Social care. Alternatively, you could enrol in nursing or midwifery.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 18 months, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your level 2 diploma and develop advanced skills in the health or social care area. You will have the opportunity to select units to suit your job e.g. care planning, dementia care, supporting people with learning disabilities, pressure area care, infection control and moving and handling.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 Diploma in Health and Social Care (Adults) for England (QCF)
course.mlo:prerequisite:
There are no required qualifications to enrol in this apprenticeship; however you need to be employed with in the health and social care sector and be aged 16 and over.

You must have completed the Level 2 Health and Social Care Apprenticeship, or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description:
If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

There are no apprenticeship course fees charged for anyone between the ages of 16 and 18.  For those aged 19 and over, fees do apply.

Contact us for more information.

Ideal if: you're working in the plumbing industry and want to start your own business, supervise other plumbers within your current firm, or complete an apprenticeship to the highest level.

You'll need: a relevant level 2 qualification.

You'll learn: how to design complex hot water, cold water, heating and sanitation systems from scratch, and learn how to comply with current Building Regulations.  There are also opportunities to learn about solar thermal hot water or gas utilisation.

Expect: to be assessed with online tests, written assignments, practical assessments and a block week when you will install, commission and handover a fully-pumped, sealed system.

You'll love: completing your full apprenticeship and achieving several industry qualifications such as a Water Regulations ticket along with your NVQ Diploma.

You'll go onto: a successful career as a plumbing and heating engineer, coming back to us regularly to update your skills and learn new technology!

 

You must enjoy working in the construction industry, have good practical and hand skills and be able to follow technical drawings and building plans. No two days are the same; you must enjoy doing a variety of tasks and be good at solving problems.

This course is offered from our Camborne campus, where you will follow the Solar Thermal route, and our Saltash campus, where you will follow the gas route.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, plumbing, engineering, services, plumber, mechanical, water, oil, thermal hot, water, gas, fires, combustio, performance, water regulations, domestic hot water, energy efficiency, building regulations, rain water, harvesting, LPG, building regulations, heat pumps, construction, city & guilds
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Plumbing Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Learn on the job and gain an advanced qualification.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Certificate, you are qualified to an advanced level and could work as a plumbing technician or be involved in designing environmentally friendly systems e.g. water management, grey water systems and rain water catchment.

You may be interested in gaining further qualifications through Cornwall College:

  • NICEIC Core Domestiv Gas Safety (CCN1) (if not already achieved)
  • NICEIC Level 3 Solar Thermal Hot Water (if not already achieved)
  • Domestic/Light Commercial Oil Firing System Installation
  • NICEIC Building Regulations Part P Domestic Installer Qualification - Defined Scope Level B
  • LPG - Boats
  • LPG - Leisure Activity Vehicles
  • LPG - Residential Park Homes
  • NICEIC Natural Gas to LPG Gas Changeover Assessment
  • NICEIC Energy Efficiency Building Regulations
  • NICEIC Gas Fires and Heaters
  • NICEIC Gas Cookers
  • Combustion Performance Analysers
  • Heat Pumps Ground and Air Source
  • Rain Water Harvesting to be offered soon

In the future, you may be interested in starting your own business, teaching or working in a management position in a variety of industries e.g. plumbing, oil, water.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place.

During this apprenticeship you will install complex cold water, hot water, sanitation and heating systems as well as fuel burning appliances such as gas (if based at Saltash campus).  At Camborne campus you will follow the Solar Thermal Hot Water route.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion of your apprenticeship from Saltash, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Water Regulations certificate
  • Unvented Hotwater Supply Commissioning and Servicing
  • NICEIC Core Domestic Gas Safety (CCN1)
  • NICEIC Water Heaters and Wet Central Heating (CENWAT)
  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Services - Plumbing 

Upon successful completion of your apprenticeship from Camborne, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Water Regulations certificate
  • Unvented Hotwater Supply Commissioning and Servicing
  •  Level 3 City and Guilds Solar Thermal Hot Water
  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Services - Plumbing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed as a plumber. You must to have completed a Level 2 in Plumbing or have the relevant experience.

You must enjoy working in the construction industry, have good practical and hand skills and be able to follow technical drawings and building plans. No two days are the same; you must enjoy doing a variety of tasks and be good at solving problems.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who are semi skilled in craft masonry and want to train on the job to become a fully qualified craft mason.

You must enjoy working in the construction industry and have good practical and hand skills.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Trowel Occupations Apprenticeship, and supports those working in a trainee trowel position.
course.dc:subject: trowel occupation, building, construction, plaster, bricklay, render, apprenticeship, brick laying, flooring, builder, design
Construction Trades
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Trowel Occupations Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a fully qualified craft mason and may progress to a foreman or supervisory level in the future.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in the Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Construction Contracting Operations, Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Site Supervision or FdSc Sustainable Construction. Thereafter you could progress to a BSc (Hons) in Environmental Construction Surveying, Building Surveying or Construction Management.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus for 1 day per week for 1 year. For practical tests, you will be required to complete a number of 1 week blocks at Cornwall College where you will build chimneys, obtuse angles and arches.

During this apprenticeship you will carry out structural and decorative brickwork, repair and maintain masonry structures and erect complex masonry structures. You will develop good communication skills and learn how to produce quotes for clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Trowel Occupations
  • Level 3 Diploma in Bricklaying (QCF)

The Level 3 Diploma in Bricklaying can also be completed as a standalone course, without going through the apprenticeship program.

The Trowel Occupations course has been adjusted for the South West region where majority of work is in stone, not brick.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within suitable position.  You must have a Level 2 Diploma in Trowel Occupations or have the relevant work experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Certificate in warehousing and distribution, you are qualified to the level of a warehouse supervisor or manager, and may find yourself progressing to a more senior position within your company e.g. management team.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management or leader management apprenticeships. Alternatively you may be interested in completing a Certificate in Logistics and Transport.
course.mlo:objective:
This apprenticeship is work based, so you will receive training on the job for 1 year.

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your Level 2 Certificate and have the opportunity to select units to suit your job. You will develop advanced skills in distribution, warehousing and storage operations, which may include learning to operate a variety of equipment and machinery e.g. forklift and compact crane.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College Business tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 Certificate in Warehousing and Distribution
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a suitable position e.g. warehouse supervisor. You must have completed the Level 2 Warehousing and Distribution Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

You must have good interpersonal skills, respect for people who use the service, good verbal and non verbal communication skills and a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job.

This apprenticeship supports those working in a variety of roles e.g. healthcare support worker, healthcare assistant, care assistant, personal assistant, relief team worker, night care assistant, support worker, mental health support or outreach worker, re- enablement worker, home care support, substance misuse worker and key workers in residential support or outreach worker.

Health & Social Care
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Health and Social Care Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of Apprenticeship level 2, you can progress onto the nationally recognised Level 3 Advanced Apprenticeship.

Upon successful completion of both the level 2 and level 3, you may progress to a more senior position e.g. senior carer or other supervisory care positions.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further by applying for a HE degree or level 5 Higher Apprenticeship, which could lead onto a care managment position.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at one of the Cornwall College sites - (Camborne, Saltash or St Austell) 1 day a week for 12 weeks; the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace, where you will need to be working up to 30 hours a week.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway and the units to suit your job e.g. infection control, dementia awareness, supporting people with learning disabilities, support for mobility, continence and hygiene care.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors and assessors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 2 Apprenticeship in Health and Social Care (Adults) for England (QCF)
course.mlo:prerequisite: To enrol on the Health & Social Care Apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in Maths and English) and be employed in a suitable position within the health and social care industry. If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Customer Service Advisors on 0800 731 7594.

Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Marine Surface Finishing Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Certificate, you are semi skilled and qualified to work as a junior marine crafts person. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Certificate by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

Upon successful completion of the advanced apprenticeship, you are a fully qualified marine craftsperson and could work as a boat builder, marine surface finisher or a marine maintenance technician. In the future, you could progress to the level of a supervisor, technical manager, programme manager or programme director within the boatbuilding industry.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in the team leading, people management, carpentry and joinery or engineering apprenticeship through Cornwall College Business. Alternatively you may be interested in the full time FdSc Boat Design and Production course, which is offered at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select a pathway to suit your job e.g. electrical installation and maintenance, mechanical installation and maintenance, sheet metalwork, manual welding, rigging, surface preparation and yacht painting. You will gain background knowledge

You may prepare and finish a variety of tasks within the project from hand grips and marine engines to repairing hulls of boats and carbon fibre masts; you will develop thorough knowledge in boatbuilding and gain valuable experience.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Marine Engineering
  • Level 2 Certificate in Boatbuilding, Maintenance and Support
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Motor Vehicle
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Vehicle Body and Paint Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you are semi skilled and qualified to work as a junior technician in vehicle repair and paint refinishing operations. Thereafter you can start working towards the nationally recognised Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

In the future, you could work as a body repair technician, body finishing technician, start your own business or teach. You may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, vehicle maintenance and repair or vehicle parts operations apprenticeship.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to select a pathway that suits your job. You will choose from the following:

  • Body repair - remove, repair, replace and fit non-structural vehicle body panels
  • Paint refinishing - prepare and apply foundation materials to vehicles and fix minor paint defects

Every vehicle will present a new challenge, with no bump and scratch being the same.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 Certificate in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
  • NVQ in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C level. You must be employed in a suitable trainee position.

course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become qualified in marine engineering
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Marine Engineering Certificate, you are qualified to the level of a junior craftsperson and may progress to a more senior position with more responsibility. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Marine Engineering Diploma, by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

This apprenticeship could be the foundation in your career and could take you in a variety of directions; in the future you could work as a designer, fitter, operator, project manager or programme director.

You may be interested in studying further and complete a Diploma in Engineering Leadership, Diploma in Business Improvement, Diploma in People Management, FdSc Engineering, HNC Engineering or a BSc(Hons) Mechanical Design and Manufacture.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Falmouth campus 1 day per week for 2 years.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway and units to suit your job e.g. installation and fitting out of boats, servicing and maintenance of marine engines, principles of marine electrical systems or producing and repairing hulls and decks.

Depending on your workplace, you may have the opportunity to work on variety of boats e.g. ships, tankers, ferry boats, fishing vessels or sporting boats.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Certificate in Marine Engineering
  • Level 2 Certificate in Boatbuilding Maintenance and Support
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Ideal if: you are looking for the confidence, skills, qualifications and experience to use a computer and various programs in the Cornwall College Microsoft Academy.

You'll learn: the technical skills needed to become an effective web developer or designer. You can choose units to suit your job role with either Adobe or Microsoft Office Specialist accreditation.

Expect: to gain skills, qualifications and experience using a variety of industry specific applications.

You'll go onto: another apprenticeship, employment within the IT industry or further studies on one of our Level 3 Information Technology courses.

Alternatively, you may prefer to develop your IT skills and enrol in further software qualifications e.g. programming, network design or network fundamentals.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or St Austell campus for 20 days across the year.

During the apprenticeship, you will learn the basics of operating a computer. You will have the opportunity to select units to suit your job role and industry e.g. email, word processing, spreadsheets, database, digital imaging, security software, trouble shooting, IT maintenance or specialist software.

This apprenticeship is designed to allow candidates to achieve the Microsoft Office Master status.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • NVQ Level 2 for IT Users (ITQ)

course.dc:title: IT Professional Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 ICT Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and gaining additional qualifications e.g. MCSA; or enrolling in a full time course through Cornwall College e.g. Foundation degree.

The IT Professional Apprenticeship could take you in a number of directions e.g. business analyst, system support engineer, IT architecture or network manager.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend workshops at our St Austell campus alongside workplace assessments.

During this apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to select units to suit your job and individual business needs. You will develop technical skills in a wide range of areas.

You will be able to choose from a selection of optional workplace units such as:

  • Software Installation and Upgrade
  • Technical Fault Diagnosis
  • Working with ICT Hardware and Equipment
  • ICT System Operation
  • User Profile Administration

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 Diploma in ICT Professional Competence
  • Level 2 Award in ICT Systems and Principles
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 3 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally Maths, English and IT), and be employed in a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship, speak to our Customer Services Team on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become a qualified nail technician.

You must enjoy working in the beauty industry and on a one to one basis with clients. You will need good hand to eye coordination to carry out your work, as well as good customer service skills as you will be working with clients all day. This apprenticeship supports those working in a trainee nail technician position.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, beauty, nails, nail, technician nail, art, spa, therapy, apprenticeship
Hair & Beauty
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Nail Services Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you will be a qualified junior nail technician where you will assist senior technicians in performing a number of procedures.  You could work in a variety of locations including salons, spas, resorts or hotels. Thereafter you may find yourself progressing to a more senior position and can start working towards the Advanced Level 3 Nail Services Diploma.

Upon successful completion of the Level 3 Diploma, you become a qualified nail technician and could work as a photographic nail artist or start your own business.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in a team leading, people management, customer service or business administration apprenticeship. Alternatively, you may be interested in the full time spa therapy course.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the St Austell campus 1 day per week for 1 year, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will assist senior nail technicians in performing manicures, pedicures, natural nail wraps, hand and nail treatments, nail extensions and basic nail art techniques.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • NVQ Level 2 Diploma in Nail Services
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in the apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed as a trainee nail technician. 

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required  GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised Diploma in Retails Skills. The skills acquired in this apprenticeship are transferable to any job or industry, so it’s a good course to kick start your career.

This apprenticeship supports a wide variety of job roles in any industry e.g. sales assistants, beauty consultants, customer service assistants, stockroom assistants, visual merchandiser and fresh food counter assistants in a bakery, fish shop or butchery.

Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Retail Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma in Retail Skills, you are qualified to an assistant’s level and you may progress to a more senior position with more responsibility e.g. senior assistant, advisor, supervisor, team leader, manager. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Diploma, by completing the advanced apprenticeship.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the Customer Service, Business Administration, Team Leading, People Management or Leader Management apprenticeships. Alternatively, you may be interested in the FdA Business or FdA E-business Management, followed by a BA (Hons) Business Enterprise through Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
This apprenticeship is work based, so you will receive on the job training for 12 months.

During this apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to select units to suit your job role and industry. You may be involved in processing orders, providing counter service or putting together the company’s visual merchandise. This course can be tailored to your industry, so you could work in a bakery, fish shop, butchery, greengrocer, pharmacy or clothing store.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving regular tutorial support from experienced tutors from Cornwall College Business.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Retail Skills (QCF)
  • Level 2 Certificate in Retail Knowledge (QCF)
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a suitable role.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Barbering Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma in Barbering, you could progress to management level, own your own barber shop or work on film sets.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on a cutting course in London, a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship or branch out and enrol in the Hairdressing Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the St Austell or Camborne campus one day per week for one year, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your Level 2 Diploma and perform creative hair cutting and design and creation of a range of facial hair shapes. You will also be involved in hairdressing consultation services and promoting services or products to clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving regular support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Barbering
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C. You must be employed within a salon environment and have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

You will need to have completed the Level 2 Barbering Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Horticulture Advanced Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Build on the horticulture skills learnt at Level 2.
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your horticultural skills and expertise, explore the further career options that become available to you or progress onto higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
You will further develop the skills and knowledge you gained at Level 2 by studying a specific pathway. The pathways are:

  • Horticulture
  • Landscaping
  • Production horticulture

course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. course.dc:description:
An animal care advanced apprenticeship will often be for those who have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 provision and/or who hold appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities performed within the workplace.

You must be employed within the sector and display a strong interest in your job role, as well as being able to demonstrate enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed as a recognised professional within industry.

Ideal if: you have already completed a relevant level 2 qualification and you work in or would like to work in the animal management industry.

You'll need: a relevant level 2 qualification or apprenticeship, although prior experience will be considered. You'll also need GCSEs at grade D or above in English and mathematics, or a level 1 functional skills qualification.

You'll learn: to further develop your animal management abilities in animal health, controlling and restraining animals, animal feeding and nutrition, breeding, monitoring and evaluating animal accommodation, and supervisory skills and management.

Expect: to spend one day each week at one of the Duchy College campus sites, and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You'll love: earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progress to university study, such as our Foundation Degree in Animal Health and Management.
course.dc:subject: Apprenticeships
Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing
course.dc:title: Animal Management Advanced Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised Animal Management qualification.
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your animal care skills and expertise, explore the further career options that become available to you or progress onto higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on the structure outlined on the level 2 apprenticeship provision. This will further develop your animal care abilities in avenues relating to areas such as:

  • Implementing and monitoring animal health, welfare and wellbeing
  • Planning, monitoring and evaluating animal accommodation
  • Controlling and restraining animals
  • Animal health, safety and security
  • Supporting animal diets and feeding regimes
  • Breeding
  • Risk assessment
  • Loading and unloading animals for transport
  • Supervisory skills and management

These advanced apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke Climsland, Rosewarne or an industry based venue.  You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: Animal care qualifications at level 2 or above will often prove to be of benefit, although they may not always be essential.  Your individual circumstances and experiences are taken into account and our Liaison Officers are pleased to support you and to discuss training avenues to suit your needs.

presentation.dc:subject: Apprenticeships
Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing

course.dc:title: Land-based Service Engineering Advanced Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Land-Based Service Engineering Advanced Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your skills and expertise, explore your career options or progress onto higher education.
course.mlo:objective:
What will I be doing on the course?
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on the structure outlined on the level 2 apprenticeship provision.  This will further develop your technical abilities and endorse your knowledge and understanding.

You will undertake the following units:

  • Maintain health and safety in the work environment
  • Establish and meet customers' technical requirements
  • Diagnose faults in tractors and machinery
  • Dismantle, assemble, repair and modify components / land-based machinery
  • Conduct testing of tractors and machinery
  • Co-ordinate work activities
  • Workshop practices
  • Welding processes and joining
  • Functional Skills (where applicable)
  • Emergency first aid (if not gained)
  • Employment rights and responsibilities

These advanced apprenticeships are delivered at Duchy College's Rosewarne campus.
You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. You should also have 2 GCSEs at grade D or above, or a level 1 functional skills qualification and be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
An agriculture advanced apprenticeship will often be for those who have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 provision and/or who hold appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities performed within the workplace. You must be employed within the agriculture sector and display a strong interest in your job role, as well as being able to demonstrate enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed as a recognised professional within industry.

Ideal if: you have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 qualification, or have appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities.

You'll need: a level 2 agriculture qualification or apprenticeship, although relevant prior experience will be considered. You'll also need GCSEs at grade D or above in English and mathematics, or a level 1 functional skills qualification.

You'll learn: to develop your agricultural abilities and advance your knowledge and understanding of practices relating to livestock and crop production. The course includes: farm visits, visiting speakers and seminars, studying farming systems and farm accounts and records.

Expect to: work with your employer for most of the week, attending college one day per week to cover 50% practical and 50% theory work. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You'll love: the chance to earn money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progress to an Agriculture City & Guilds Extended Diploma, an Agricultural Business Management City & Guilds Diploma Level 4 (work-based) or to university study such as our Foundation Degree in Agriculture.

Ideal if: you have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 qualification, or have appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities.

You’ll need: a level 2 agriculture qualification or apprenticeship, although relevant prior experience will be considered. You'll also need GCSEs at grade D or above in English and mathematics, or a level 1 functional skills qualification.

You’ll learn: to develop your agricultural abilities and advance your knowledge and understanding of livestock practices. The course includes: farm visits, visiting speakers and seminars, studying farming systems and farm accounts and records.

Expect: to work with your employer for most of the week, attending college one day per week to cover 50% practical and 50% theory work. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You’ll love: the chance to earn money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You’ll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progress to an Agriculture City & Guilds Extended Diploma, an Agricultural Business Management City & Guilds Diploma Level 4 (work-based) or to university study such as our Foundation Degree in Agriculture.

Advanced apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke Climsland, Rosewarne or an industry based venue. You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.dc:subject: Agriculture
course.dc:title: Agricultural Livestock Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Develop your understanding of livestock practices, earning money whilst you learn.
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your craft skills and expertise, explore the further career options that become available to you or progress onto higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on the structure outlined on the level 2 apprenticeship provision. This will further develop your agricultural abilities and will advance your knowledge and understanding of practices relating to livestock / crop production.

The course includes farm visits, visiting speakers and seminars. As well as studying farming systems you will also be introduced to farm accounts and records.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. You should also have 2 GCSEs at grade D or above, or a level 1 functional skills qualification and be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
This modern fish frying apprenticeship programme is being taken up by employers across the UK for both new entrants and established employees, young and old workers, and even by the occassional manager.

As well as being paid, you will work towards a nationally recognised qualification with the full support of Duchy College and your employer. The fish frying advanced apprenticeship programme is supported and promoted by Seafish, the Seafood Training Academy and the National Federation of Fish Friers.

Apprenticeships are work-based training programmes; most of the training is 'on the job' - at the employers premises. The rest is provided by Duchy College , normally on a one day per week basis. Employment is expected to be for a minimum of 30 hours per week (which includes the college based element of the training).

An apprentice will benefit from:

  • Experiencing the work first-hand, as well as gaining a nationally recognised qualification
  • Meeting with potential employers and colleagues
  • Being able to guage for themselves if the job is for them

An employer will benefit from:

  • Increased productivity
  • Developing a skilled, motivated and qualified workforce
  • A financial return on investment

Units on the Level 3 advacned apprenticeship include:

  • Frying
  • Oil management
  • Planning
  • Customer service and food service operations
  • The science behind fish frying

Apprenticeships are primarily undertaken at the employer's workplace, with college attendance offered through block release provision predominantly at our Rosewarne or Stoke Climsland campuses, or at one of our outreach centres. A liaison officer will visit you at your workplace to support your learning, and offer you further support and guidance as required.
course.dc:subject: Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Fish Frying Advanced Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Fish Frying apprenticeship, earn while you learn.
course.learningOutcome: You could progress onto our FdSc Food Studies degree.
course.mlo:objective:
This apprenticeship is made up of two parts. One part is a number of general topics that are common to all apprenticeships in the UK, such as workplace food safety, workplace health and safety, first aid at work, hazard analysis and critical control points, functional skills (where applicable) employee rights and responsibilities, personal learning and thinking skills. The second part is then a Level 3 Fish and Shellfish Certificate.

The length of an apprenticeship varies depending on your prior skill levels, experience and the industry sector. Generally, apprenticeships offered by Duchy College take between one and two years to complete.
course.mlo:prerequisite: The only entry requirement is that an apprentice has to be employed and working in a fish frying business when starting the apprenticeship programme.
