course.dc:description:
A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.  An advanced apprenticeship is for people who have achieved a level 2 qualification eg 4 GCSE or an intermediate (level2) apprenticeship or similar.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.  Food Manufacturing apprenticeships are available with a wide range of specialisms such as bakery, butchery, meat processing, dairy, fish and beverages.
course.dc:subject: Food, Butchery, Drink, Milk, Cheese, Dairy, Meat, Fish, Bakery, Poultry, Manufacturing, Advanced Apprenticeship, Food Manufacturing, Level 3
Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Food Industry Skills Advanced Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: Achieving an Advanced Apprenticeship would enable you to progress onto one of our degree courses.
course.mlo:objective:
The Advanced Apprenticeship is composed of three separate areas which are: a food qualification specific to your area of the food industry; Personal Learning and Thinking Skills and Employment Rights and Responsibilities.  Additionally, if you do not have GCSE English and Maths, you will undertake key or functional skills.  Much of the learning on the course will take place at your place of work and will include the practical skills developed there and supported by specialist knowledge delivered by your work place mentor and our team of tutors.

The food qualification is made up of a combination of units of study to create a bespoke learning plan and the areas on offer include butchery, bakery, dairy, fish and seafood and food manufacturing excellence.  Within these units you will study subjects such as food safety and HACCP (hazard analysis) systems.

Some of the learning will also take place in College, either at our Rosewarne campus or at Stoke Climsland in the Food Manufacturing Centre.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. You should also have 2 GCSEs at grade D or above, or a level 1 functional skills qualification and be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

Apprenticeships

course.dc:title: Green Keeping Advanced Apprenticeship
course.abstract: You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on your ability to support a high standard of ground preparation
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your skills and expertise, explore the further career options that become available to you or progress onto a further educational opportunity.
course.mlo:objective:
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on your ability to support a high standard of ground preparation for playing surfaces such as golf, football, cricket and rugby.  Here you will work towards a level 3 work-based diploma in horticulture 'sports turf' and a technical qualification, with topics including:

. Manage, repair and renovate sports turf
. Plan and set out sports turf areas
. Create grassed and planted areas
. Estimate resources and programme work
. Health, safety and security
. Prepare and apply pesticides
. Manage yourself and information for action
. Equipment and machinery (optional)
. Emergency first aid course
. Employment rights and responsibilities
. Functional skills (where applicable)

These advanced apprenticeships are delivered at Duchy College's Stoke Climsland campus.  You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. You should also have 2 GCSEs at grade D or above, or a level 1 functional skills qualification and be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become a qualified spa therapist. You must enjoy working in the beauty industry and enjoy working on a one to one basis with clients.

This course supports those working in a trainee beauty or spa therapist position.
course.dc:subject: spa salon massage facial water treatment holistics beauty therapy stone therapy aromatherapy apprenticeship
Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Spa Therapy Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Diploma in Spa Therapy, you could work in a variety of locations including salons, spas, resorts, health clubs, hotels, cruise ships or start your own business.

Working hours in the beauty industry are becoming more flexible with salons open longer hours during the week and over weekends.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in specialise in a variety of treatments e.g. holistic therapies, nutrition, laser, skin care or dermatology. There is plenty of room for growth in the beauty industry and this apprenticeship is a good stepping stone in your career!
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the St Austell or Saltash campus 1 day a week for 1-2 years, depending on prior experience and qualifications.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your Level 2 Diploma in Beauty or Nail Services and learn advanced techniques in spa therapy. You will:

  • Learn body massage, stone therapy treatments, head massages and pre-blended aromatherapy oil massage
  • Learn to operate sauna, steam and hydrotherapy treatments and monitor clients undergoing these treatments
  • Contribute to the planning and implementation of promotional activities and material for the spa

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Spa Therapy
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within the beauty or holistics industry.  You must have completed a Level 2 Diploma in Beauty or Nail Services or have relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

presentation.dc:subject: Hair & Beauty
presentation.dc:title: Spa Therapy Apprenticeship Level 3

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you want to obtain an industry recognised gas qualification and become a Domestic Gas Heating Engineer.

You'll need:at least three GCSEs at grade C or above and to take an initial assessment.  You will also need to seek employment with a gas heating company, where you will work under supervision with a qualified person.

You'll learn: topics such as installation, commissioning, service and maintenance techniques, health and safety, the combustion and poperties of gas, and building services and structures.

Expect: to attend college one day a week for the 3-year duration of the course.  There will also be block weeks to complete the practical elements.  You will be given training on both theory and practical on all units throughout the course, You will take assessments which consist of pracical elements, examinations and assignments, and will need to collect evidence in the workplace.

You'll love: learning the skills to gain an excellent career opportunity in an exciting and ever evolving industry.

You'll go onto: employment or study for additional gas qualifications to further your knowledge, experience and employability within the industry.
course.dc:subject: Gas, Apprenticeship, Level 3
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Gas Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Gas Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: After completing the course, you will be a gas safe registered engineer, qualified to work on gas boilers and water heaters ( natural and LPG ). Following this, you can add space heating and gas cookers as extras.
course.mlo:objective:
Study will be from the very basics of where natural gas comes from and how it gets to domestic properties and into appliances, to learning how appliances work and how to repair them. Central heating, gas utilisation, water heaters, gas fires and cookers will be explored. You will be assessed through a number of online exams, workshop practical assessments, workplace assessments and culminate with the equivalent of ACS gas assessment.

This programme has some plumbing elements - you will still need a good level of competence in pipework installation and understand the fundamentals and design of plumbing systems.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
It is preferable that you have a good sound English and maths background, with GCSE's at grade C and above.

Previous other qualifications will be considered, all candidates will have an initial assessment and interview.

Construction Trades

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Hairdressing. You must enjoy working within a salon environment and enjoy working on a one to one basis with clients.
course.dc:subject: hairdressing, hair, hairdresser, cutting, apprenticeship, salon, level 2
Hair & Beauty
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Hairdressing Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma in Hairdressing, you become a qualified Junior Stylist and can work in salons or hotels. In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on the Level 3 Hairdressing Apprenticeship, where you will cover the more advanced colour and cutting techniques.

Thereafter, you could progress to a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship, a cutting course in London or branch out and enrol in the Barbering Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell and Saltash campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will work as a salon junior booking appointments and performing shampooing, conditioning, drying, styling and colouring of hair. You will also be involved in hair and skin testing and the principles of hair colour selection for clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Hairdressing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a salon environment. You must have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Ideal if: you want to train on the job and gian a nationally recognised qualification in furniture making.

You'll need: to have good practical and hand skills, be able to follow technical drawings accurately and have good attention to detail.  This course supports those working in a trainee furniture making position.

You'll learn:  the process behind the production of furniture, working with natural and manufactured materials.  During this apprenticeship you wok on training puieces then progress to making a cabinet and side table.  You will compile a competance portfolio to evidence your daily task, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Expect: to attend the workshop on campus for one day a week, with the remainder of the week spent in the workplace.  During this time you will gain a wide variety of skills associated with the making of high quality hand crafted furniture.

You'll love: acquiring the skills to produce beautiful pieces of furniture whilst working alongside other dedicated craftspeople.

You'll go onto: employment, a higher level apprenticeship or further study at level 3.

course.dc:title: Furniture Making Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This furniture making apprenticeship is ideal for those who want to train on the job and gain nationally recognised qualifications.
course.mlo:assessment: You will be required to put together a portfolio of evidence to show your competence at your everyday tasks, and make a series of training pieces in the college workshop.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship. Thereafter, you could work as a restorer, hand crafted furniture maker, french polisher, furniture development technician, senior furniture designer, teacher or start your own business.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, wood machining or carpentry and joinery apprenticeship. Alternatively, the full time FdA Creative Practice course may interest you, where you can specialise in furniture design.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will carry out a series of practical training pieces before progressing on to making a cabinet and a side table. You will learn the process behind the production of standard items of furniture and work with natural and manufactured materials while reading and producing technical drawings.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Furniture Making (QCF)
  • Certificate in Furniture Production
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed in a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Ideal if: you want to train on the job to become a qualified engineer

You'll learn: how to produce models and drawings on a CAD system and use a variety of applications

Engineering
course.dc:title: Performing Engineering Operations Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become a qualified Engineer
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma in Performing Engineering Operations, you are qualified to the level of a a junior craftsperson and may progress to a more senior position with more responsibility. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Diploma, where you can select from Engineering Maintenance, Fabrication and Welding, and Mechanical Manufacturing.

This course could be the foundation in your career, and in the future you could work as an electrical engineering technician, electronic engineering technician, engineering craft/CNC machinist, engineering maintenance fitter, engineering operative, mechanical engineering technician, metals industry production operative, project manager or programme director.

You may be interested in studying further and completing a Diploma in Engineering Leadership, Diploma in Business Improvement, Diploma in People Management, an HNC in Engineering or an FdSc Engineering.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or St Austell campus 1 day per week for 2 years.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway to suit your job e.g. engineering practices or technical support. You may produce models/drawings on a CAD system and use a variety of applications e.g. fabrication and welding or maintenance engineering.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Performing Engineering Operations
  • Level 2 EAL Diploma in Engineering and Technology
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Wood Machining Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 Wood Machining Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.  Thereafter, you could work as a wood machinist, CNC programmer, technician, quality assurance manager, supervisor, designer or teacher.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, carpentry and joinery or furniture making apprenticeship. Alternatively, the full time BTEC Diploma in Construction and Built Environment or the FdSc Sustainable Construction course may interest to you, both are offered by Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will learn the correct methods for setting out joinery and using wood machines to current legislation. You will produce sawn, planed, profiled, jointed, sanded and bored timber, and timber based products using CNC/NC machines.

Depending on your job role and industry, you may have the opportunity to work on a variety of products e.g. desks, doors, stairs or floorboards.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • NVQ Diploma in Woodmachining (Construction/Sawmilling)
  • Level 2  Diploma in Woodmachining QCF
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Plant Maintenance Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Plant Maintenance Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: After completeing this course, you may progress onto the Advanced Apprenticeship and complete the Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Plant Maintenance.
course.mlo:objective:
Completion of the Level 2 Apprenticeship can take up to 2 years. The Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Plant Maintenance requires 9 units, which include:

  • Servicing and Maintenance of Plant
  • Removing and Replacing Components
  • Dismantling and Assembly of Equipmemt
  • Maintaining the Work Area
  • Carry Out Routine inspection
  • Diagnosing Faults in Plant and Equipment
  • Repairing Equipment by Soldering and Welding Ferrous and Non-ferrous Materials
  • Manual Handling and Lifting Equipment
  • Testing of Equipment to Determine Serviceability
course.mlo:prerequisite: School leavers should ideally have GCSE grade C in maths, English and science, but support is available to those who need it. Those leaving further education to go into work, should have completed a relevant level 1 engineering qualification. Mature learners need to show a commitment to training and have an appropriate work history.

course.dc:description:
An animal care apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility. You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.

Ideal if: you work in or would like to work in the animal management industry.

You'll need: two GCSEs at grade D or above, or relevant prior experience.

You'll need: to be employed in the industry, but if you are not, we may be able to help you find an employer.

You'll learn: to develop and demonstrate competence in a range of areas which may include promoting and maintaining health and well-being; animal handling and grooming, assisting in the movement of animals, customer care, information and advice, delivering basic treatment to animals and housing, hygiene and maintenance.

Expect: to spend one day each week at one of the Duchy College campus sites, and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics. You'll love earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects, progress onto further study on courses such as the Animal Management City & Guilds Subsidiary or Extended Diploma or an animal management advanced apprenticeship.
course.dc:subject: animals, care, animal care, caring, zoo, zookeeper, warden, zoo warden, animal carer
Apprenticeships
Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing
course.dc:title: Animal Management Intermediate Apprenticeship
course.abstract: An animal care apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work based diploma in animal care, further or higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to two years to complete where you will work towards the Level 2 Diploma in Work-based Animal Care.  On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in a range of areas, which may include:

• Promoting and maintaining health and wellbeing
• Providing food and water
• Housing and cleanliness
• Animal handling and grooming
• Assisting in the movement of animals
• Customer care, information and advice
• Developing personal performance and positive working relationships
• Delivering basic treatment to animals
• Health and safety
• Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
• Emergency first aid
• Employment rights and responsibilities

These apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke Climsland, Rosewarne or an industry based venue.  This normally means one day each week spent at college and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. 

You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will also visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing

  • Understanding the sales environment
  • Understanding sales techniques and processes   
  • Understanding the legal, regulatory and ethical requirements in Sales
  • Principals of personal responsibilities and working in a business environment.  
  • Understanding sales target
  • Understanding business awareness in sales
This programme is ideal for those moving up the career ladder or looking to develop some specialist skills such as understanding buyer behaviour or face to face selling.
course.dc:subject: sales, apprenticeship, level 2, retail
course.dc:title: Sales Apprenticeship Level 2
course.mlo:objective:
The Cornwall College Business Sales Apprenticeship provides those who are embarking in a new career in sales with the knowledge and skills needed to progress within a sales and telesales profession. The areas covered range from generating and qualifying sales leads, building rapport with customers to negotiating and closing sales. The Sales & Telesales workforce is one of the largest professional groups in the UK today, employing around 7% of the UK workforce, or just over two million people.  

In addition, there are many more non-specialists for whom selling is an essential part of their job role – particularly within the four million small and medium sized enterprises in the UK.  

The course provides employers of all sizes and across all sectors in England with a high quality, nationally recognised programme which will attract new talent into Sales and Telesales and up skill the existing workforce to make businesses more productive, efficient and profitable.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in an administrative role.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Customer Advisors on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description: The Land-based Service Engineering Apprenticeship is available to people of all ages who are employed maintaining and servicing agricultural or groundcare equipment.
course.dc:subject: agriculture, farming, farmer, tractor, fixing, diggers, 360s, engineering, engineer, land-based, landbased, horticulture, groundcare, estate management, groundwork, land, farmland, fields,
Land-based Engineering & Construction Plant
course.dc:title: Land-Based Service Engineering Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Land-Based Service Engineering Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: Learners with proven ability at level 2 can progress into the Advanced Apprenticeship and complete the Level 3 Diploma in Landbased Engineering Operations
course.mlo:objective:
Completion of the Level 2 Apprenticeship can take up to 2 years. The Level 2 Diploma in Land-based Engineering Operations covers 14 units.

  • Monitor and Maintain Health and Safety
  • Applying Mechanical Principles
  • Service and Maintain Tools and Equipment
  • Material Preparation, Shaping and Assembly
  • Servicing and Maintenance on Landbased Equipment
  • Thermal Cutting and Joining Processes
  • Service and Repair Cooling and Lubrication Systems
  • Service and Repair Electrical Systems
  • Service and Repair Hydraulic Systems
  • Maintain and Develop Personal Performance
  • Establish and Maintain Effective Working Relationships With Others
  • Service and Repair Engines and Components
  • Service and Repair Mechanical Transmission Systems
  • Service and Repair Soil Preparation and Plant Establishment Equipment

Key Skills or Functional Skill in Application of Number, Communication and ICT are required at Level 1.

The attendance pattern and duration depends on previous experience but the programme is likely to require at least one day attendance per week for up to two years.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:title: Butchery Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: A butchery apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical butchery skills or explore further education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
The overall butchery apprenticeship training provision focuses on enhancing the learner's ability to practice specialist industry skills and to consistently demonstrate appropriate levels of competence.  This is delivered with the ongoing support of our dedicated team members, offering guidance to both the learner and the employer.

Programme content:
• Induction
• Emergency First Aid Certificate
• Level 2 in Food Safety
• Level 2 in Health and Safety
• Butchery Skills (knife cutting skills)
• Functional Skills or Key Skills (where appropriate)
• Employer Rights and Responsibilities

Level 2 Certificate for Proficiency in Meat and Poultry, with choices offered in:
 - Meat and Poultry Processing Skills
 - Butchery Retail Skills

As part of the underpinning structure, we actively encourage our apprentices to participate in our educational visits to an:
- Livestock farm
- Abattoir ~ to reflect on the wider process 'from farm to fork'
- Cutting plant ~ to witness the butchery process on a large scale

The above is intended to give support, aiding the learner's principal understanding towards animal welfare, the slaughter process, meat hygiene regulations and the grading of differing carcasses.

Progression and achievement is primarily structured through the collection of project evidence, short course certificates, witness testimonies, observations and direct questioning techniques.  A judgement is then made to determine the individual's overall knowledge, practical skill and capability.

Butchery apprenticeships are primarily undertaken at the learner's workplace, with college attendance through block relea

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you want to become a qualified engineer, this apprenticeship provides an ideal foundation for a wide range of occupations within the engineering field.

You'll need: to be employed in a relevant role and ideally have three GCSEs at grade C or above in English, mathematics and IT.  You must have good practical skills, be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically.

You'll learn: modules including fabrication and welding, maintenance engineering and machining.

Expect: to have the opportunity to tailor your learning to suit your job.

You'll love: learning a whole new range of skills.

You'll go onto: an engineering advanced apprenticeship, or further study at level 3 such as our Engineering Extended Diploma.

course.dc:description:
A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.

Ideal if: you are already or would like to be employed in the food and drink industry.

You’ll need: two GCSEs at grade D or above, although relevant prior experience will be considered.

You’ll learn: the principles of working in food manufacture, safe preparation, food processing, how to monitor and maintain product quality and food hygiene.

Expect: a wide range of work-based activities to help you understand the systems essential for good practice, safe preparation and processing in line with the quality standards demanded by industry and today’s customers. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You’ll love: earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You’ll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progression to the Food and Drink Manufacturing advanced apprenticeship.
course.dc:subject: food, food production, food manufacture, food technology, food tech, butchers, apprentice, apprenticeships
Apprenticeships
Catering & Hospitality
Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Food Industry Skills Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: Work-based Food Manufacturing Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work-based diploma in Food Manufacturing or further / higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
The programme contains a wide range of work-based activities that help you to appreciate the systems that are essential for good practice, safe preparation and processing. These are operated in accordance to the quality standards demanded by industry and by today's customers.

The overall food manufacturing apprenticeship provision focuses on enhancing your ability to practice specialist industry skills and to consistently demonstrate appropriate levels of competence.  This is delivered with the ongoing support of our dedicated team members, offering guidance to both the learner and employer.

You will undertake a Level 2 Certificate for Proficiency in Food Manufacture, with choices offered in:

  • Distribution skills
  • Operational skills
  • Craft Bakery skills
  • Process Bakery skills
  • Production Control skills
  • Brewing Industry Skills
  • Fish & Shellfish Industry Skills
  • Butchery Industry Skills
  • Food Manufacturing Excellence / Lean Manufacturing

Programme content includes:

  • Principles of working in food manufacture
  • Essential areas of production
  • Systems for good practice
  • Monitor and maintain product quality
  • Safe preparation
  • Food processing
  • Control mixing and size reduction
  • Monitor and maintain product quality
  • Food hygiene
  • Maintain workplace food safety
  • Uphold workplace health and safety in food manufacture
  • Diagnose and rectify operating problems
  • Organisation and continuity in the workplace
  • Emergency first aid course
  • Level 2 Award in Food Safety
  • Level 2 Award in Health and Safety
  • Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility. You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.
course.dc:subject: greenkeeper, greenkeeping, golf, golf course, green, greens, tees, fairways, fairway, golf clubs, apprentice, apprentices, apprenticeships,
Apprenticeships
Sport
course.dc:title: Green Keeping Apprenticeship
course.abstract: A green keeping apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills and expertise, progress onto the advanced work based diploma in horticulture (sports turf) or further / higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to two years to complete where you will work towards the Level 2 Diploma in work-based horticulture (sports turf).  On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in the following areas:

• Establishing plants outdoors
• Maintain the health of sports turf
• Present, maintain and repair sports turf surfaces
• Use and maintain equipment and machines
• Monitor and uphold health and safety practices
• Develop personal performance and good working relationships
• Prepare and operate a tractor with attachments
• Industry based enhancements
• Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
• Emergency first aid
• Employment rights and responsibilities

These apprenticeships are offered with day release tuition delivered at our Duchy
College Stoke Climsland campus, with the majority of the remaining time spent working
out in the commercial industry.

You will also be assigned a Liaison Officer who will also visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
A horse care apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.
course.dc:subject: horses, horse care, equine, equestrian, showjumping, animal management, animal carer, vet, veterinary, horse, apprentice, apprenticeship
Apprenticeships
Conservation, Zoology and Animal Behaviour
Equine
course.dc:title: Horse Care Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Horse Care Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work based diploma in horse care, further or higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to eighteen months to complete where you will work towards the
Level 2 Work-based Diploma and technical qualification. On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in the following areas:

• Maintain health and well-being of horses
• Preparing horses for use
• Supervision, riding and exercising
• Feeding and welfare
• Cleaning of stables
• Loading and unloading horses under supervision
• Ensure own actions reduce risks to health and safety
• Maintain effective working relationships
• Health and safety with horses certification (technical certificate)
• Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
• Emergency first aid
• Employment rights and responsibilities

In addition to the above, a further specialist pathway will be undertaken relating to:

• Care of performance horses
• Riding
• Exercising
• Driving
• Leading a trek
• Assisting riders with special needs
• Reproduction and care of young stock

These apprenticeships are delivered at our Duchy College Stoke Climsland campus with possibilities at Rosewarne or an industry based venue. This normally means one day each week spent at college and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer.
You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will also visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

There are no apprenticeship course fees charged for anyone between the ages of 16 and 18.  For those aged 19 and over, fees do apply.

Contact us for more information.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in site carpentry or bench joinery.

You must have good practical and hand skills, be able to follow technical drawings accurately and have good attention to detail.

Cornwall College Business will help you choose the right pathway to suit your job; this apprenticeship supports those working as a trainee site carpenter or bench joiner.
course.dc:subject: Wood, occupation, carpentry, joinery, timber, apprenticeship, construction, carpenter, joiner, cabinet making, city & guilds, CG, C&G, city and guilds
Construction Trades
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Carpentry and Joinery Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.  

Once you are a qualified carpenter or joiner, you may progress to the level of a supervisor or manager. If you work for a large company, you could work as a planner and estimator, designer, production controller or specialist craftsperson. Alternatively, you could start your own business or teach wood occupations.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, wood machining or furniture making apprenticeship. The full time BTEC Diploma in Construction and Built Environment or the FdSc Sustainable Construction course may interest to you, both are offered at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures 1 or 2 days per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will learn all aspects of site carpentry or bench joinery. The site carpentry course covers truss roofing, hanging doors, kitchen fitting and windows installation; while the bench joinery course covers making doors, windows and stairs.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • NVQ Diploma in Wood Occupations (Construction)
  • Level 2 Diploma in Site Carpentry or Bench Joinery
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Business Administration.

If you are efficient and enjoy organising people and resources, this is a great apprenticeship for you to start your career. This apprenticeship supports a variety of administration job roles in any industry e.g. executive assistants, secretaries, administration assistants, data entry clerks and office juniors.
course.dc:subject: Admin, administration, admin assistant, Business foundation degree,business management, management, marketing, planning, post grad, retail business, public services, enterprise, marketing, management, accoutnancy, human resource, business law, business development, venture, employability, leadership, strategy development, business finance, legal, economics, research,
Business, Administration & Law
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Business Administration Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
Upon successful completion, you can progress onto another Level 2 qualification in a complimentary subject such as Customer Service, Sales or IT.  To progress onto Level 3 your role must include additional responsibilities which may involve supervision or training.

Completing both the Level 2 and Level 3 Business Administration apprenticeships will help you progress in your career through senior administration to management.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the customer service, team leading, people management or leader management apprenticeships. Thereafter, you may wish to study further and complete an FdA Business or FdA E-business Management, followed by a BA (Hons) Business Enterprise through Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
This course consists of six mandatory units and a range of optional units to suit your job role, to give a minimum of 45 credits in total.  Delivery will consist of class-based and work based learning.  The mandatory units are:

  • Communicate in a business environment
  • Principles of providing administrative services
  • Principles of business document production and information management
  • Understand employer organisations
  • Manage personal performance and development
  • Develop working relationships with colleagues

You then select the optional units to suit your specific job role, which may include:

  • Use a telephone and voicemail system
  • Manage diary systems
  • Store and retrieve information / Archive information
  • Use and maintain office equipment
  • Maintain and issue stationery stock items
  • Prepare documents/ Prepare text from notes using touch typing
  • Support the organisation of an event / meeting / travel and accommodation

As part of the apprenticeship framework you are required to complete Functional Skills in English, Maths and ICT at Level 1 unless exemptions are provided.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in an administrative role.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in accounting.

You must enjoy working in an office environment and be good with numbers. The AAT Level 2 apprenticeship is roughly equivalent to GCSE Grades A-C, and supports those working in a trainee accounting position.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in accounting.

You must enjoy working in an office environment and be good with numbers. The AAT Level 2 apprenticeship is roughly equivalent to GCSE Grades A-C, and supports those working in a trainee accounting position.
course.dc:subject: accounting, accountancy, apprenticeship, business finance, bookeeping, accounts, clerk, AAT, CIPFA, CMA, ICAEW, ilm
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Accounting Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in accounting
course.learningOutcome:
From this apprenticeship, you could progress to the AAT Level 3 Diploma and then advance to the AAT Level 4 Diploma.

Upon completion of all 3 levels of the accounting apprenticeship, you could work as an Accounts Clerk, Credit Control Assistant, Finance Assistant or Purchase Ledger Clerk in any type of business or industry.

Thereafter you could progress to a full membership of the Association of Accounting Technicians and then complete a professional accounting qualification with a chartered body:

  • CIPFA - The Chartered Institute of Public Finance and Accountancy
  • ACCA - Association of Chartered Certified Account
  • CIMA - Chartered Institute of Management Accountants
  • ICAEW - The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales

Alternatively, you may wish to enrol in a management apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business or a full time business related course at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 35 weeks, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place. There are a number of start dates throughout the year, contact Cornwall College Business for more information.

During this apprenticeship, you will learn finance administrator skills e.g. double entry bookkeeping, basic costing principles, and purchase, sales and general ledgers. You will also learn how to use Sage accounting software.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

AAT Level 2 Accounting Certificate
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in the AAT Level 2 Accounting Certificate, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a trainee accounting position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:title: Plumbing Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in plumbing.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Certificate, you are a qualified plumber and can start working towards the Advanced Level 3 Certificate. At this point you could complete the Domestic/Light Commercial Oil Firing System Installation qualification, or complete this after the level 3 apprenticeship.

Upon successful completion of the Level 3 Apprenticeship, you are qualified to an advanced level and could work as a plumbing technician or be involved in designing environmentally friendly systems e.g. water management, grey water systems and rain water catchment.

You may wish to gain further qualifications through Cornwall College:

  • Domestic/Light Commercial Oil Firing System Installation
  • NICEIC Building Regulations Part P Domestic Installer Qualification - Defined Scope Level B
  • LPG - Boats
  • LPG - Leisure Activity Vehicles
  • LPG - Residential Park Homes
  • NICEIC Natural Gas to LPG Gas Changeover Assessment
  • NICEIC Energy Efficiency Building Regulations
  • NICEIC Level 3 Solar Thermal Hot Water
  • NICEIC Gas Fires and Heaters
  • NICEIC Gas Cookers
  • Combustion Performance Analysers
  • Heat Pumps Ground and Air Source to be offered soon
  • Rain Water Harvesting to be offered soon

In the future, you may be interested in starting your own business, teaching or working in a management position in a variety of industries e.g. plumbing, oil, water.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place. During this apprenticeship you will install basic cold water, hot water, sanitation and central heating systems.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving  support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Plumbing and Heating
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in Maths and English) and be employed within a training plumbing position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description:
If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

There are no apprenticeship course fees charged for anyone between the ages of 16 and 18.  For those aged 19 and over, fees do apply.

Contact us for more information.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in craft masonry. You must enjoy working in the construction industry and have good practical and hand skills.

This course supports those working in a trainee craft masonry position.
course.dc:subject: trowel, plaster, bricklay, occupation, construction, building, apprenticeship, craft mason, brick laying, flooring, builder, plastering, city and guilds, CG, C&G, city & guilds
Construction Trades
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Trowel Occupations Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you are qualified to a semi skilled level in craft masonry and can start working towards the Level 3 Diploma by completing the advanced apprenticeship. Once you are fully qualified, you could progress to a foreman or supervisory role within the construction industry.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and complete a Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Construction Contracting Operations, Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Site Supervision or FdSc Sustainable Construction. Thereafter you could progress to a BSc (Hons) in Environmental Construction Surveying, Building Surveying or Construction Management.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus 1-2 days per week for 2 years. For practical tests, you will be required to complete a number of 1 week blocks at Cornwall College.

During this apprenticeship you will build cavity walling forming masonry structures, plaster and render surfaces, interpret working drawings to set out masonry structures, maintain slate and roof tiling and build solid walling masonry structures.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Trowel Occupation
  • Level 2 Diploma in Craft Masonry (QCF)
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed in a trowel position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This first stage Certificate in Education and Training qualification is designed to support those who are working or hope to work as teachers or trainers in the Further Education and Skills Learning Sector.
course.dc:title: Education and Training Certificate
course.learningOutcome: Successful completion of this qualification will support you in applying for teacher and training roles in the Further Education and the Skills Learning Sector and progress onto the Level 5 Diploma in Education and Training.
course.mlo:objective: Those who study this qualification will gain understanding of the roles and responsibilities of a teacher in relation to legislation, equality, diversity, inclusivity and meeting the needs of learners. You will learn to use initial and diagnostic assessments and plan and deliver inclusive teaching and learning. You will also be able to assess learning and use appropriate resources to support effective learning.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You will need to have access to 30 hours of teaching to study this course.

presentation.dc:title: Education and Training Certificate

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information call Sue Searle on 01209 617519 or e mail  sue.searle@cornwall.ac.uk

Postgraduate Certificate in Education (PGCE) incorporating the Diploma in Education and Training (DET)  is specifically designed for graduates with a commitment to teaching in the Lifelong Learning sector: Further Education; Community Education; Work-based Learning and similar public sector, voluntary and commercial settings.

The course is offered as both a one year full-time programme at Cornwall College sites in Camborne and St Austell, and as a two year part-time programme in St Austell, Camborne and Saltash and/or Stoke Climsland.

If you decide to study full time, you will be required to attend College for two days a week with additional teaching practice over two or three days a week and other directed study, including the use of our Virtual Learning Environment. If you decide to study part time, you will attend college for approximately 3 hours per week, through the day or in the evening.

Modules

Year 1

  • Learning, Teaching & Assessment (30 credits)
  • Principles of Teaching & Innovation, Enterprise & Employability (30 credits)

Year 2

  • Curriculum & Society (30 credits)
  • Wider Practice & Professional Development (30 credits)
course.dc:subject: PGCE, Cert Ed, DTLLS, CTLLS, PTLLS, Teaching, Teacher, Training, Lifelong Learning Sector, Certificate in Education, niceic, Postgraduate, part time, Certificate
The School of Education and Professional Development
course.dc:title: Postgraduate Certificate in Education (Part Time)
course.abstract: Designed for graduates with a commitment to teaching in the Lifelong Learning sector
course.mlo:assessment: The course is assessed through coursework, observation and practice.
course.learningOutcome:
This nationally endorsed qualification prepares you to work as a teacher or trainer anywhere in the Lifelong Learning sector. It allows you to meet the initial training requirements for membership of the Institute for Learning and will underpin an application for Qualified Teacher of Learning and Skills (QTLS) status.

 

 

 

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression.

 

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm)

 

Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
The PGCE  programme supports you in becoming an effective and well-informed teacher of your chosen subject. You will follow a core programme in college throughout the academic year, where you will be involved in presentations, seminars, practical workshops, tutorials, lectures and directed study through our Learning Centre and Virtual Learning Environment. Cor modules

The programme consists of four core modules. Over the four modules, you will explore and analyse current ideas related to teaching and learning in post compulsory education and training, also known as the Lifelong Learning sector.

The programme offers a balance of practical skills, reflection and related education theories. The core modules will be concerned with the processes of teaching and learning, assessment, principles of teaching, continuing personal and professional development, curriculum and society and wider professional practices.

The opportunity to consider all these areas specifically in the light of your own professional life, subject specialisms and experience will be central to your professional development. Through individual professional development planning, the programme gives you the chance to evidence your developing practical skills, knowledge and understanding in relation to a range of aims and targets. It also allows you to reflect upon the complex relationships between practice and theory.

You will follow a teaching practice programme of at least 100 hours, where you will also get invaluable help from other experienced teachers of your subject. Your tutor will support both parts of your training and will regularly observe you teaching. Observations will also be undertaken by other experienced teachers.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
You must hold qualifications relevant to the subject you teach or have substantial relevant work experience.  A full Bachelor's Degree, plus an  English Language qualification at level 2 and Mathematic qualification at Level 1 or above.

 

Proof of qualifications will be required at interview stage.

 

A Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check will be a mandatory requirement after you have been accepted on the programme. It is your responsibility to undertake this before commencing your study.

UCAS Code: LL53

This three year BSc Honours degree course is for anyone who has an interest in Health, Community and Social Sciences and for those who wish to pursue a career in a related area. The course has been designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge base required to work in your chosen specialism or progress onto other graduate opportunities. It is also a platform from which you can undertake additional vocational and academic qualifications and requires you to undertake work based learning and gain an honours degree that can be completed in Cornwall. The course has been designed with a number of pathways which will allow you to specialise within a particular area of study.

Year 1

Core Modules:

  • Keeping Children, Young People and Adults at Risk Safe (20 credits)
  • Values and Ethics in the Workplace (20 credits)
  • Professional Practice: Skills for Employment (20 credits)
  • Health, Welfare and Social Policy (20 credits)
  • Sociological Perspectives (20 Credits)
  • Developmental Psychological (20 credits)

Year 2

Core Modules:

  • Research in Social Issues (20 credits)
  • Psychology and Interactions (20 credits)
  • Applying Social Theory (20 credits)
  • Development through Work (20 credits)

Optional Modules* (choose 40 credits):

*Optional modules are subject to availability

  • Independent Study (20 credits)
  • The Sociology of Health (20 credits)
  • Perspectives on Disability & Learning Disability (20 credits)
  • Psychological Processes in Learning (20 credits)
  • Issues in mental Health (20 credits)
  • Social Enterprise (20 credits)
  • History of Western Political and Social Theory (20 credits)
  • Leadership Practice (20 credits)

 Year 3

Core Modules:

  • Health, Community and Social Sciences Dissertation (40 credits)

Optional Modules* (choose 80 credits):

*Optional modules are subject to availability

  • Promoting Health (20 credits)
  • Work-based Learning (40 credits)
  • Rural Poverty (20 credits)
  • Working with Young People (20 credits)
  • Youth justice (20 credits)
  • Alternative Interventions (20 credits)
  • Childcare and Mental Health (20 credits)
  • Collaboration and Multi-agency Working (20 credits)
  • Social and Political Identity (20 credits)
  • Psychology in Practice (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: Health, Social Work, Community, Mental Health, Welfare, Support Worker, Youth and Community and Nursing, access
Social Care & Health
course.dc:title: BSc (Hons) Health, Community and Social Sciences
course.abstract: The course has been designed with a number of pathways which will allow you to specialise within a particular area of study.
course.learningOutcome: Successful students can apply for relevant Masters level Programmes at another University or a PGCE Course here at Cornwall College or enter employment in appropriate fields such as local government, community development, teaching, youth justice, management, family support work, drug and alcohol rehabilitation, housing development and research. The degree will allow students to develop a number of graduate skills such as critical analysis, research, presentation skills and interpersonal skills which make them attractive to employers. The MA in Social Work at Plymouth University is an approved progression route subject to meeting the admissions criteria of Plymouth University. As a graduate you will have a wide choice of employment opportunities throughout the private and public sectors. The University of Plymouth Colleges enjoy a good record for the employability of their graduates. Career development and planning are supported in tutorials and the College Career Service is available for advice and support during the academic year. Cornwall College fosters links with relevant local agencies and the work based learning modules in years 1, 2 and 3 provide you with the opportunity to network, develop your skills and undertake work experience which is a vital part of gaining employment after a degree programme.
course.mlo:objective: Your programme of study will give you a firm grounding in the skills and knowledge needed for successful employment in the field as well as the academic rigour that you will continue to develop throughout your degree. The second and third years allow you to select optional modules which suit your career aspiration. In Year 2, for example, if you were interested in a career in Mental Health then you might choose the psychology and mental health based units such as Issues in Mental Health and Psychological Processes. An interest in Health may lead you to study Sociology of Health. You could choose to look at the Social Sciences and study Applying Social Theory and History of Western Political Theory. For students interested in Psychology, you may wish to choose Perspectives on Disability. In Year 3, modules are on offer to allow you to continue your interest in a particular pathway. For example, students interested in psychology and mental health may choose to study Childcare & Mental Health and/or Psychology in Practice and/or working with young people. Following an interest in Health, you may wish to study Promoting Health and/or Collaboration & Multiagency Working. Students interested in the Social Sciences may choose to study Youth Justice, and/or Social and Political Identity and/or Rural Poverty. This level of choice means that you can really make this programme work for you and the career that you want to enter.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
180 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 140 points must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - MMP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or emailenquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

A Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check will be a mandatory requirement after you have been accepted on the programme. It is your responsibility to undertake this before commencing your study.

course.dc:description: This course is normally taught over one morning, afternoon or evening a week for 12 weeks through venues in Camborne, St Austell, Saltash, Duchy Stoke Climsland and other centres throughout Cornwall.  For more information contact Sue Searle at the School of Education and Professional Development - 01209 617519  sue.searle@cornwall.ac.uk

This course is for those with an interest in developing their teaching skills.  You should have an idea of the subject/area you would like to teach and ideally hold qualifications or have relevant work experience in the subject you want to teach.

The Award in Education and training is designed for both people who need a nationally recognised training qualification to successfully deliver certain areas of their professional role and for those who might be considering a career in teaching or training but want to test the water before committing to a longer or more expensive course.

During the course you will participate in a range of activities designed to reflect the current methodology of student-centred teaching. You will learn how to engage difficult or unwilling students and how to ensure students reach their full potential through stimulating and motivating activity. You will understand how people learn and how to plan lessons accordingly. You will explore the limits of the teacher’s role and see how this goes beyond simple subject delivery. You will be enabled to design meaningful assessment activities, to avoid death by powerpoint and know how to include students with a wide range of learning preferences.
course.dc:subject: PGCE Cert Ed DTLLS CTLLS PTLLS Teaching Teacher Training Preparing to teach in the lifelong learning sector Award in Education and Training DET
The School of Education and Professional Development
course.dc:title: Education and Training CG Award Level 3
course.abstract: The Award in Education and Training Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
On completion of the course you will be in possession of a nationally recognised teaching / training qualification. You will have already covered much of the first module of the full-time teaching course and you will be in a position to know which areas of education or training you are most suited for.

Upon completion of this course you could use your skills in a variety of educational roles and continue your studying by taking a Certificate or Diploma in Teaching in the Lifelong Learning sector.
course.mlo:objective: This is a practical course introducing the skills, knowledge and understanding required by successful teachers and trainers in the Lifelong Learning sector.  You will explore Core teaching Skills, Personal Management, Management of Groups and Interpersonal Skills, all linked to ideas about theory and practice of post-compulsory teaching and training.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This course is for those with an interest in developing their teaching skills.  You should have an idea of the subject/area you would like to teach and ideally hold qualifications or have relevant work experience in the subject you want to teach.   The course requires written assignments and a candidate would benefit from holding English  and Mathematics qualifications at level 2 or above - (GCSE A*-C, Key Skills qualifications at level 2 or Adult English and Mathematics qualifications at Level 2).  Course members are expected to attend all the taught course sessions.

course.dc:description:
To achieve the full QCF Certificate in Assessing Vocational Achievement, all 3 units have to be achieved.  Please contact Elaine Hocking for further information on 01209 617671 or elaine.hocking@cornwall.ac.uk.

We offer 3 Course Intakes for this Academic year starting in October in Camborne, December in St Austell and in February in Camborne; please contact us for further information.

The course is for practitioners who need to be qualified to use all methods of assessment - i.e. those who will be carrying out the role of an assessor in a work environment and vocationally related situation (i.e. classroom/workshop/simulated environments). 

A full range of assessment methods must be used: - e.g. in a work environment: observation, examining work products, oral questioning and discussion, use of others (e.g.: witnesses), learner statements and recognition of prior learning (RPL); and in vocationally-related situations e.g. classrooms or workshops, assessment in simulated environments, skills tests, oral and written questions, assignments, projects, case studies and recognition of prior learning (RPL).
course.dc:subject: Assessor Assessing A1 TAQA Assessors
Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Assessing Vocational Achievement CG Certificate Level 3
course.abstract: Level 3 A level and Equivalent
course.learningOutcome: You will receive a Level 3 Certificate in Assessing Vocational Achievement from City & Guilds to confirm that you have achieved the Knowledge & Understanding Unit, the Assessing Competence in the Work Environment Unit and the Assessing Vocationally Related Achievement Unit.
course.mlo:objective:
A two day induction to the course will cover the background knowledge and understanding aspects of the Award and the assessor role you will be required to carry out.  You will continue to work with the Course Tutor through group/one-to-one support at subsequent sessions.

Within the Assessment Centre, you will work closely with at least two learners, through components of their qualification.  You will meet with your Course Tutor/Assessor regularly and build a portfolio of evidence.  You will also be required to work/liaise with other assessors and internal quality assurance staff at your Assessment Centre.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This will depend of the specific occupational area and the Award Sector Skills Council/Awarding Organisation Assessment Strategy; however, it is anticipated that occupational competence and experience of working within the sector may be required.  You will also need to be working with/attached to an Approved Assessment Centre that is offering the QCF/NVQ Award you are planning to assess and have two real learners to assess in a real work environment and assess in a simulated environment i.e. in a workshop or classroom.

To achieve the full QCF Certificate in Leading the Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practices, all 3 units have to be achieved. For further information please contact Elaine Hocking on 01209 617671 or by email elaine.hocking@cornwall.ac.uk.

We offer 3 Course Intakes for this Academic year starting in October in Camborne, December in St Austell and in February in Camborne; please contact us for further information.

This course is for practitioners who Lead the Internal Quality Assurance Process, within an Assessment Centre/Organisation; and have a responsibility for managing the quality of the assessment process, practice and the performance of Assessors.  They may also develop systems and lead on visits from outside agencies such as Awarding Organisations.
course.dc:subject: "Internal Verification" "Internal Verifier" IV V1 verifier verification IQA Verifiers
The School of Education and Professional Development
course.dc:title: Leading the Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practice CG Certificate Level 4
course.abstract: Internal Quality
course.learningOutcome: You will receive a Level 4 Certificate in Leading the Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practice from City & Guilds to confirm that you have achieved the Knowledge & Understanding Unit, the Internally Assure the Quality of Assessment Unit and the Plan, Allocate and Monitor Work in Own Area of Responsibility Unit.
course.mlo:objective:
A one day induction to the course will cover the background knowledge and understanding aspects of the Award and the role as the Lead Internal Quality Assurer (IQA) you will be required to carry out.  You will continue to work with the Course Tutor through group/one-to-one support at subsequent sessions.

Within the Assessment Centre, you will Lead the QA process and allocate work, within your own area of responsibility.  As an IQA you will also be required to work closely with at least two assessors, each with a minimum of two candidates of their own, through components of a qualification.  In your role as Lead IQA, you will also work with and co-ordinate with others from External Agencies i.e. Awarding Organisations, as well as meeting with your Course Tutor/Assessor regularly and build a portfolio of evidence.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This will depend of the specific occupational area and the Award Sector Skills Council/Awarding Organisation Assessment Strategy; however, it is anticipated that experience of working as a QCF/NVQ Assessor may be required.  Your role would also require a level of responsibility of Leading and Managing the QA process.

course.mlo:objective:
A two day induction to the course will cover the background knowledge and understanding aspects of the Award and the assessor role you will be required to carry out.  You will continue to work with the Course Tutor through group/one-to-one support at subsequent sessions.

Within the Assessment Centre, you will work closely with at least two learners, through components of their qualification.  You will meet with your Course Tutor/Assessor regularly and build a portfolio of evidence.  You will also be required to work/liaise with other assessors and internal quality assurance staff at your Assessment Centre.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This will depend on the specific occupational area and the Award Sector Skills Council/Awarding Organisation Assessment Strategy; however, it is anticipated that occupational competence and experience of working within the sector may be required.  You will also need to be working with/attached to an Approved Assessment Centre that is offering the QCF/NVQ Award you are planning to assess and have two real learners to assess in a real work environment.

course.dc:description:
The new QCF qualification for Internal Quality Assurers (IQA)/ Internal Verifiers, replaces the previous V1 Award.  The structure of this particular qualification is made up of 2 units; the first relates to Knowledge and Understanding and in most instances will be achieved in conjunction with the second unit (as mentioned above), which relates to Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practice. For further information please contact Elaine Hocking on 01209 617671 or by email elaine.hocking@cornwall.ac.uk.

We offer 3 Course Intakes for this Academic year starting in October in Camborne, December in St Austell and in February in Camborne; please contact us for further information.

This course is for practictioners who conduct internal quality assurance of the Assessment process, from within an Assessment Centre/ Organisation; by sample planning, monitoring and advising on the practice of assessors.
course.dc:subject: "Internal Verifier" verifier verification IV V1 IQA Verifiers
The School of Education and Professional Development
course.dc:title: Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practice CG Award Level 4
course.abstract: Internal Quality
course.learningOutcome: You will receive a Level 4 Award in the Internal Quality Assurance of Assessment Processes and Practice from City & Guilds to confirm that you have achieved the Knowlede & Understanding Unit and the Internally Assure the Quality of Assessment Unit.
course.mlo:objective:
A one day induction to the course will cover the background knowledge and understanding aspects of the Award and the role you will be required to carry out.  You will continue to work with the Course Tutor through group/ one-to-one support at subsequent sessions.

Within the Assessment Centre, you will work closely with at least two assessors, each with a minimum of two candidates of their own, through components of a qualification.  You will meet with your Course Tutor/ Assessor regularrly and build a portfolio of evidence.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This will depend on the specific occupational area and the Award Sector Skills Council/ Awarding Organisation Assessment Strategy; however, it is anticipated that experience of working as a QCF/NVQ Assessor may be required.
