course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you would like a great foundation to your career in nail services.


You'll need: at least two GCSEs at grade C or above, in English & Mathematics, or an equivalent qualification.


You'll learn: excellent industry-level skills such as how to perform pedicures, manicures, nail art and  client consultations.


Expect: to be continually assessed throughout your course through practical assessments and examinations.


You'll love: the regular tutorials and demonstrations in our purpose-built salons.


You'll go on to: an apprenticeship or further studies at level 3 on our Nail Services Diploma.
course.dc:subject: Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Nail Technology Services CG Certificate Level 2
course.abstract: Nails
course.learningOutcome:
After successfully completing the course, you will have achieved the basic practical skills to allow you to work in industry.

However, it is always an advantage to offer as many different treatments as possible to your clients, so once you have achieved your Level 2, we would recommend that you enhance your knowledge base and develop your skills by progressing onto Level 3 Nail Technology Services, or diversify to Beauty Therapy or Hairdressing. These courses are all good options when you are considering up-skilling.

Once you have the right set of qualifications, they could take you all over the world. Past students have gone on to manage their own business, travel on cruise liners, work in the world of television or as session nail technicians at photographic shoots
course.mlo:objective:
You will be learning in our purpose-built salons, training in a commercial environment and learning nail service techniques from industry professionals. They will demonstrate everything that you need to know and you will then practice the skills that you have been shown on friends and family.
Eventually, you will be providing treatments to paying clients. From consultations to pedicure, manicure and nail arttreatments. You will be trained to industry standards.
You will also have the opportunity to develop your work-based skills, working on the salon reception, promoting products and practicing retail services.
Regular tutorials and demonstrations from teaching staff will embed your knowledge, giving you the confidence to practice nail services in paid employment.

Assessments are carried out during practical lessons on paying clients along with some on-line testing.
If you are 16-19 you will continue to develop your skills of Maths, English, Employability and Work Experience as a part of your study program.


This course provides a great foundation for a career as a nail technician.
You will be preparing for industry and are looking to get a good grounding in nail services. This qualification will provide you with the essential salon skills to help you get employed in the industry.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
You will need to have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at grade c, in English and Maths or an equivalent qualification.

At Cornwall College, we recognise that applicants can often offer a high level of competence as well as life experience and we will therefore consider all applications on their merits alongside their qualifications.

If you are unsure as to whether or not you meet the requirements, please call the Hairdressing and Beauty Department and ask to speak to the course manager who will be happy to discuss it with you.

course.dc:description:
This course is an ideal start if you are thinking about pursuing a career in the beauty therapy industry as an apprentice.

As part of your course you will study the following practical elements: facial treatments, eye treatments, hand/foot and nail treatments, waxing treatments, make-up treatments, in addition to science, theory, health and safety and working within a team.

You will train in our purpose-built salons which reflect a commercial environment providing treatments to paying clients. All treatments are provided at industry standards and reflect current trends.

Assessments are carried out during practical lessons along with some on-line testing.
course.dc:subject: Beauty, therapist, beautician, hair and beauty, aromatherapy, complementary therapy, massage, reflexology, spa therapy, make-up, treatments, tinting, manicures, facials, waxing, eyelash and brow treatments,
Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Beauty Therapy CG NVQ Diploma Level 2
course.abstract: uty Therapy CG NVQ Diploma Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
Cornwall College offers the complete pathway in Beauty Therapy and you could take your qualifications all over the world. Past students have gone on go on to managing their own salon, travel on cruise liners and teach. There are a number of opportunities available to you once you have the right set of qualifications; from beauty therapist or consultant to image and department advisor, merchandiser or product promoter.

No single qualification covers all of the different services offered by a beauty therapist so once you have achieved your level 2, we would recommend that you develop your specialist skills by progressing onto other courses at Cornwall College.
Beauty Therapy Techniques CG Diploma Level 3, Massage CG NVQ 3, Complimentary Therapy Techniques, Spa Therapy or a Nail Services course are all good options when you are considering up skilling.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
You will need to be employed in the workplace as an apprentice and have a minimum of 2 GCSEs in English and Maths.

 

At Cornwall College, we recognise that applicants without these qualifications can often offer a high level of competence as well as life experience and we will therefore consider all applications on their merits alongside their qualifications.

 

If you are unsure as to whether or not you meet the requirements, please call the Beauty Department and ask to speak to the course manager who will be happy to discuss it with you.

course.dc:description: Spa Therapy consists of non-medical treatments which help with the overall health of the body. If you are involved in massage, stone therapy, hydrotherapy, body wrapping and floatation treatments and you would like a qualification to demonstrate your specialist skills, or you have worked in a salon, spa or similar job for some time and have gained your level 2 beauty therapy/nail services qualification, this course may be for you.
course.dc:subject: spa beauty apprenticeship beauty therapy spa treatments progression advanced apprenticeship level 3 spa NVQ in spa treatments
Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Spa Therapy CG NVQ Diploma Level 3
course.abstract: spa, beauty, apprenticeship, therapy, treatments, progression,
course.learningOutcome: Afterwards, you may use your new qualification to gain employment in a resort, destination spa, day spa or beauty salon. Opportunities exist in the UK as well as overseas for this fast growing industry. You may move into management or become a trainer, lecturer or a company field technician.
course.mlo:objective:
Students on this course also get to develop their work based skills; recognising the importance of professional practice. You will be involved with induction, consultation, treatment care and advice, as well as tailoring aftercare advice to individual clients.

Our tutors are industry professionals and they will demonstrate the practical techniques as well as best practice so that you can be sure that you are equipped with the skills and know-how to perform these treatments independently.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
There are no formal entry requirements for this course. However, a level 2 qualification in beauty therapy or nail services is an advantage. As with all beauty professions, you will need to create the right impression with your clients and must therefore be professional, courteous and discreet.  Excellent communication skills are essential.

This is an intensive, knowledge-based course and we do look for enthusiasm and motivation to succeed on the course.

If you are unsure as to your suitability for this course, please contact the Course Manager at the College who will be happy to discuss the course and its content with you.

course.dc:description:
This course is delivered at various sites.

In order to obtain this qualification, you must attend both days and complete the two units of accreditation.

This course is for those who are working with children and infants. It will be of particular interest to teachers, child minders, crèche assistants, playgroup personnel and anyone else who has a responsibility for their welfare whilst in your care.

It is ideal for individuals who are responsible for children and infants, who wish to gain a nationally accredited Level 3 Award.

In order to obtain this qualification, you must attend both days and complete the two units of accreditation. You will be gaining knowledge and competence to administer administer first aid and basic life support.
course.dc:subject: Paediatric First Aid 2 day course
course.dc:title: Paediatric First Aid FAA Award Level 3 (2 Day)
course.learningOutcome:
CERTIFICATION

Assessment is ongoing by the instructor in respect of the student’s practical skills and there will be multiple choice question paper to answer in respect of their knowledge.


A three year certificate will be issued, subject to assessment.
course.mlo:objective:
Unit 1

  • Responsibilities and reporting; Resuscitation; Wounds and bleeding; Minor injuries; Infection control; Anaphylaxis; Shock; Eplilepsy; First Aid; Dealing with an unresponsive casualty; Assessment of the situation; Choking; Recovery position
     

Unit 2

  • Head injuries; Fractures; Febrile convulsions; Ear, eye and nose injuries; Electrical injuries; Sickel cell anaemia; Diabetes; Foreign bodies; Burns and scalds; Meningitis; Asthma; Heat and cold; Bites and stings; Poisoning
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Learners must be 16 years or older

In order to obtain this qualification, you must attend both days and complete the two units of accreditation.

course.dc:description:
This course is a 20 credit module (CORC170) from a Foundation Degree, awarded by Plymouth University.

Contact us for more information.

This course is for anyone who wishes to improve business processes in your organisation. You will address a work based problem/issue within your organisation and develop a good systems- based analysis.
course.dc:subject: lean service management dlsc degree level short courses lean services systems event planing uop university of plymouth plymouth university
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Lean Service Management
course.learningOutcome:
Upon successful completion, you will have the confidence to use your improved business processing skills in your organisation.

There are several flexible progression opportunities for delegates onto other performance boosting degree level short courses, including: People development and leadership; Business enterprise, leadership and growth; Finance for non-financial managers and many more. Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
This course introduces a range of lean concepts for analysis and improvement of business processes. It focuses on how and why different work activities take place to achieve an end value, while questioning aspects of the work environment from value and structure to management approach.

This course covers:

  • Systems analysis using Vanguard and other models to understand real business processes in a systems context
  • Core lean concepts of value, value stream, flow, pull and incremental continuous improvement
  • Value stream planning and continuous improvement A3 style project management
  • Change management issues.

There will be a number of tutorial and group sessions to support your analysis and project work. You will be assessed according to your systems analysis, project plan and presentation of project implementation. In practice real projects are not always completed within the timescale, so you may present your project in its current status.

There will be a short test at the end of the module.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

presentation.dc:subject: Business, Administration & Law
presentation.dc:title: Lean Service Management Level 4

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you have experience of working in a kitchen and woud like to learn advanced skills in preparing and cooking complex dishes, store keeping and supervisory skills.

You'll need: the City & Guilds Level 2 Diploma in Food Preparation and Production or are working in a first-class establishment. Equally, you can be a mature student who has the right drive and commitment to succeed and who wants to achieve a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll learn: how to increase your key skills in a specialised area.  Being a very practical course in its approach, the content allows you to learn advanced techniques that meet both national and international standards. 

Expect: to be assessed throughout your course through assignments, projects and practical examinations.

You'll love: learning the techniques you will need to have, to work as a specialised chef in a professional kitchen.

You'll go onto: employment in the industry, or further studies at Foundation Degree level.
course.dc:subject: Professional Cookery NVQ Work Based Food Hospitality Chef Kitchen
Catering & Hospitality
course.dc:title: Culinary Skills CG Diploma Level 3
course.abstract: Earn a Level 3 qualification whilst working in the industry
course.mlo:assessment: You'll be assessed throughout your course through assignments, projects and practical examinations.
course.learningOutcome: After successfully completing the NVQ 3 and with sufficient industry experience you will have the opportunity to progress onto a Foundation Degree. This qualification will also enable you to apply for positions in first class establishments with the knowledge that the qualification will enhance your job prospects.
course.mlo:objective:
The course is designed for students with a basic knowledge of cookery and who wish to increase their skills in a specialised area. It is very practical in content and allows the students to learn advanced techniques that will meet both national and international standards. The course is designed to be completed in 1 year and the units covered may be different depending on which site you choose to study at.

NVQ3 Advanced food preparation and cooking ( Kitchen larder)

  • Principles of food preparation and cooking
  • Functional skills
  • ERR
  • CIEH level 3 food safety award
  • Sustainability in Professional Kitchens level 3
  • Food science and molecular cookery
  • Menu planning and food costing
  • Allergen training
  • Butchery work shop
  • Fish and shell fish work shop
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements. However, because of the advanced nature of the course it is advisable that you are either the holder of NVQ level-2 Food Preparation and Production or City and Guilds 706/1 and 706/2 or are already working in a first class establishment. Equally, you can be a mature student who may never have attended college and would like to gain a nationally recognised qualification. In all cases real enthusiasm for the industry and a love of food is vital.

course.dc:description:
The Day release course begins in September 2012.

For those who already hold a 6129 technical certificate there is no specific entry date, you can start when it suits both yourself and your employer. You have up to two years to complete this.   Funding is available for some apprentices, however you may need to achieve key skills at level two in maths, English and ICT as part of the programme. 

For people that are not on an apprenticeship scheme there currently is no funding available.

If you require any further information and confirmation on course costs or funding options please contact us.

This course is aimed at anyone currently working in the industry as a plumber or heating engineer.

This will be studied on a one day a week, day release basis with performance units completed in the workplace.  For candidates who have previously completed the 6129 technical certificate and are now working in the industry, you will be assessed only in the workplace and will not need to attend college.

course.dc:description: In this class there will be yoga posture and breathing exercises.  The class starts and finishes with relaxation

Yoga courses are open to everyone: improve your health and sense of well-being through the practice of Hatha Yoga, the science of health. Students are asked to bring a blanket or sleeping bag and wear loose clothing and a warm sweater.

In this class there will be yoga posture and breathing exercises.  The class starts and finishes with relaxation

Jane Housley-Jeive, Dip DSY, is our yoga teacher on Yoga, Practice & Understanding course here at Saltash.  Read more about Jane..............

I am passionate about Yoga.  I took my first lessons in 1997 and have been practicing ever since, studying different styles with a variety of teachers.  Between 2006 and 2008 I undertook a teacher training course with the Devon School of Yoga, qualifying in 2008.  

Since qualifying I have held a regular weekly class in Saltash and regularly attend workshops with the Devon School and other teachers.  In 2012 and 2013 I went to the Devon Yoga Festivals and experienced many different styles.  I have also been to workshops on the chakras (energy centres) and meditation with Swami Saradananda.

 I’m a firm believer that yoga is for everyone, not just the body beautiful.   In fact, I think that the less flexible can probably get more benefit from yoga than the more supple.   Postures can be modified to suit all abilities, including those unable to stand for long – so long as you can breathe you can do yoga! 

 My style is eclectic, taking the best from all my teachers.  Each class includes postures, breathing, a short meditation and relaxation.

course.dc:description:
Term One of this course is ideal for those people who have no or little French language skills.

Term Two of this course would be ideally suited to students who have recently completed the Term One course but would be of equal value to people who have previously completed some formal study or have a grasp of the French language who wish to refresh and further develop and build on their language skills.
course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: French - Beginners (JE)
course.abstract: Learn how to speak French.
course.learningOutcome: You can try one of our other language courses or any of our other recreational courses or workshops.
course.mlo:objective:
Term One will be structured in a simple and easy to understand format with a specific topic being covered each session. The course is friendly and fun, with an emphasis on participation by all students. Your tutor will assume you have no previous knowledge. You will learn basic spoken language for everyday situations, for pleasure, business, or for socialising.

Term Two will be more student led in order to control the pace and allow time to further develop and build confidence.   Students will be involved in a number of activities such as introducing yourself, describing your family, your job, shopping, ordering meals, booking accommodation, asking directions, dislikes and likes etc.

course.dc:description:
Boost your career, start to learn a new trade or just pick up some handy DIY skills.

This course will allow you to build your skills CV and gain a recognised qualification while training around work and family commitments at the weekend.

Learn practical skills in the workshops at Cornwall College Camborne and work with experienced tutors to achieve a new qualification.

Each course is the equivalent of one unit of the City and Guilds qualification and is the ideal length for you to get a real taste of college life, while working on projects ranging from building chimneys and tiling roofs, to creating your very own piece of furniture.

Call us now on 0800 731 7594 to find out how to book your place.

course.dc:title: Developing Plastering Skills City & Guilds Unit Level 1
course.abstract: Saturday Skills course in Plastering skills
course.learningOutcome: After completing Saturday Skills you may wish to continue on another part-time or full-time course, or put your skills into practice in the workplace.
course.mlo:objective:
During the ten weeks you will learn the basic skills in your chosen craft as well as health and safety practices in the workshop.

Areas covered include:

  • Introduction to basic tools and their uses
  • Applying materials to solid backgrounds
  • Plastering techniques including skimming and dot-and-dab
  • Plaster boarding techniques
  • How to render and patch plaster

course.dc:description:
Students will be required to purchase the following items of personal uniform from the suggested supplier or from a supplier of their choice to wear on the course. 

 Cadet Uniform package cost £40 inc VAT consisting of: Assault boots, Soldier 95 trousers, shirt and Ripstop jacket, 2 piece cameo wet weather suit and commando socks. Available from:http://www.britishmilitarysurplus.co.uk/ishop/1069/shopscr43.html

 In addition, a tracksuit and T shirt embroidered with the College Military Academy logo is required and can be purchased from: http://www.plymouthmilitarygifts.com/store/Duchy_College.html Embroidered Track Suit £32.99, embroidered T shirts £4.50.

 Large or expensive items of kit such as Bergens, cooking equipment, tents, sleeping bags etc will be provided by the College.  Students are encouraged to purchase/bring their own sleeping bags etc if they prefer. A refundable deposit of £35 is required for the issue of College kit and equipment.

 There is an additional cost of £55 for the 3 day survival school training course which is delivered by an outside provider and £20 for issue of rations for overnight exerccises.

 

Financial support may be available from the student support fund, details are available from Student Services.

The NCFE Level 2 Diploma for Entry to the Uniformed Services is part of the Cornwall College Military Academy and is designed to prepare potential recruits for entry to the Armed Forces. The programme is portfolio based therefore there are no examinations. All theory and practical assessment will be conducted in the class room or out-doors as suitable. Learners will undertake practical military training and education in order to equip them with the necessary skills to enable them to make decisions on which service to apply for and to prepare them in all respects for initial selection. Alongside the main qualification learners will undertake GCSE or functional skills in English and/or maths dependant on their entry qualifications.
course.dc:subject: Public Services
course.dc:title: Entry to the Uniformed Services NCFE Diploma Level 2
course.abstract: The NCFE Level 2 Diploma for Entry to the Uniformed Services is part of the Cornwall College
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of your course you can apply for selection to the Armed Service of your choice. 

Or you can progress to :

  • Entry to the Uniformed Services NCFE Diploma (Military Academy) Level 3
  • Public Services (Uniformed) BTEC Extended Diploma Level 3 (5 x GCSE grade C including English and/or maths are required for this course).
course.mlo:objective:
The aim of this course is to prepare you for Armed Forces selection. You will study a number of units which will improve your overall fitness and stamina levels and equip you with the knowledge and skills to allow you to perform to the best of your ability at the Armed Forces selection centre. 

Units include:

  • Investigate employment in the uniformed services
  • Physical fitness for the uniformed services
  • Develop team working and problem-solving skills
  • Health and safety in the uniformed services
  • Health and hygiene in the uniformed services
  • Carry out map reading and navigation
  • Follow uniformed services routine
  • Exploring equality and diversity for the uniformed services
  • Participate in competitive sports
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal academic entry requirements for this course. However, learners will be expected to be able to work towards GCSE or functional skills in English and/or maths dependant on individual entry qualifications.

presentation.dc:title: Entry to the Uniformed Services NCFE Diploma Level 2 (Military Academy and Public Services)

Some applicants may be eligible for financial support on this course to assist with childcare, transport etc. The Learner Support Fund is under review and is determined by individual circumstances.

If you are under 24 years of age, you may be eligible for fee remission. Information will be given within the workshops, however if your require more information contact the college your applying for and speak to Student Services for further details.

If you are 24 years of age  or over, please click on this link for funding information and a direct link to the government funding site.

Funding for over 24

The Access to Higher Education Diploma is a nationally recognised qualification thatprovides students with the entry requirements for most higher education degrees. Itconsists of a minimum of 20 units of study which include: Study Skills, ICT and a wide rangeof subject specific Art & Design units. As a part of this course students will also be providedwith tutorial guidance which focuses on UCAS applications and preparing for universitystudy. There is currently a very large choice of higher level courses in the creative arts.Although this is essentially a progression course into university study, several of ourlearners use this learning opportunity to prepare for the world of work, combined with parttimeFoundation degree Award (FdA) engagement.

The Access course is a 1 year, full time course, especially intended for those people whohave always wanted to study art and design, but have not previously had the chance to doso. The course runs over 3 days (Wed, Thurs & Fri). The college study time is designedaround people with family and, or work commitments i.e. start times are in line with schoolstart times. In addition, students are expected to spend 5 hours a week as home study.

This is a vibrant and exciting course, during the first term you will be introduced to the basic principles of 2D visual language; through drawing, mark-making, mixed media,photography and graphics. At the same time you will be able to develop your knowledge ofthe history of art and design, through illustrated talks and gallery visits. You will also have the opportunity to improve your research and I.T. skills.

In the second term, you will engage in-depth with the exploration of materials, techniques and processes, through drawing, mixed media, Textiles and Ceramics. The assignments will introduce you to concepts and ideas in art and design and how these are connected to the materials and techniques used to communicate ideas for different creative purposes. Additional study skills units run alongside these practical units.

Before the start of the third term you will be encouraged to think about a topic for the Independent Study, which is intended to consolidate all that you have been taught on the course, up to that point. You will be able to choose the topic, materials and techniques to produce a final piece or series of works for presentation in a final exhibition, at the end of the year.

The course will begin in September and end in June, it runs for 3 days a week from Wednesday to Friday (15 hours pr week plus additional study time).

For further details please contact the course manager Bobbie Russell, Cluster Manager, on 01209 617636 or e-mail bobbie.russell@cornwall.co.uk

On the Access course you will have the opportunity to have support with your academic studies; which could include support from the Learning Centre tutors, as well as support from the teaching staff to help facilitate your learning.

If you are under 24 years of age, you may be eligible for fee remission, if you do not hold a level 3 qualification. If you are 24 years of age or over, there is a new 24+ Learners' Loan available.
course.dc:subject: Art Design Graphics Photography Mixed Media Textiles Ceramics.
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: Art and Design ASCENTIS Access to HE Diploma Level 3
course.abstract: The course will enable you to gain a broad experience of different subjects in art, design and technology.
course.learningOutcome: This course will prepare you for study at HNC or HND, Foundation Degree or Honours Degree level in any creative subject of your choice. Many courses at this level are available at Cornwall College at our Camborne site.
course.mlo:objective: The course will enable you to gain a broad experience of different subjects in art, design and technology. These will include drawing, painting, printmaking, photography, graphic design, 3D work, programming, animation etc.. It will also provide the opportunity to identify the area of specialisation most relevant to your aspirations and ability. There will also be a structured programme of academic studies supported by a general core skills programme that will provide an English GCSE equivalent and prepare you for the demands of higher level study. The core skills will help you develop confidence and improve written and oral communication, as well as provide career planning, research skills and an understanding of art history and information technology.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
There are no specific entry requirements, but you will need to have enthusiasm, commitment and a desire to further your education in the arts. If you wish to apply you will need to bring along a portfolio, of work, to an informal interview. This could contain any of the following: drawing, painting, craft work, photography, sculpture etc. Applicants will be required to complete an initial assessment to identify any support needs.

If you would like further information about the course please contact:

Bobbie Russell, Cluster Manager, on 01209 617636 or e-mail bobbie.russell@cornwall.co.uk

All applicants will be requried to undertake a minimum of 2 half days or 1 full day per week work palcement throughout the duration of the course.  Learners will be visited in the workplacment by an Assessor who will undertake observation of working practice.

all applicants will be required to have a clear DBS check prior to enrolment.  DBS may be applied for through the college at a cost of £44.

This course is for volunteers or existing teaching assistants in Primary, Secondary or Special schools who are working under the direction of the class teacher. They will contribute to planning, implementing and evaluating learning activities and will work alongside the teacher to support whole class activities, as well as working on their own with individuals or groups of pupils.
course.dc:subject: Teaching Assistant, TA, Support, Schools, Primary, Secondary, Children,
The School of Education and Professional Development
course.dc:title: Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools CG Certificate Level 3
course.abstract: For volunteers or existing teaching assistants in Primary, Secondary or Special schools
course.learningOutcome: Upon successful completion of this course, you may be able to gain employment as a teaching assistant. Having gained sufficient school experience you will have the opportunity to progress onto the Foundation Degree for Children and Young Peoples Workforce.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend a weekly class at one of our campuses, and carry out some home study alongside your work in the classroom. You will need to be able to spend 1-2 hours per week building your portfolio. You will be offered regular tutorial support.

You will work towards nationally recognised units from the QCF (Qualifications and Credit Framework) to achieve the Level 3 Certificate in Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools. Taught sessions will cover key aspects, including:

  • Supporting learning activities
  • Promoting children and young people's positive behaviour
  • Supporting assessment for learning
  • Understanding child and young person development
  • Understanding how to safeguard the wellbeing of children and young people
  • Promoting Equality Diversity and Inclusion
  • Developing professional relationships with children, young people and adults
  • Schools as organisations
  • Communication and professional relationships
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Support staff will need to have sufficient language, literacy and numeracy skills at the level required to support pupils' learning.  Relevant skills and attributes include:

  • Experience of working in a school
  • Interest and commitment to working with children and/or young people
  • Ability to relate well to children, young people and adults
  • Willing to reflect on your own practice, learn and apply that learning in the workplace

You must provide a positive check through the Disclosure & Barring Service.

presentation.dc:title: Supporting Teaching and Learning in Schools City & Guilds Certificate Level 3

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Introduction to Printing Seamless Repeat Patterns on Textiles
course.abstract: Students will be introduced to different methods of printing continuous and intricate pattern repeats onto cloth.
course.learningOutcome: After the course you could try one of our other leisure courses or workshops.
course.mlo:objective:
Students will be introduced to different methods of printing continuous and intricate pattern repeats onto cloth.  Using traditional techniques they will work on their own designs and print them on material using screens or blocks.  Teamwork is involved at the exciting printing stage when individual and unique designs are realised in lengths of about 3 metres.  

Dyes, printing pastes, tools and equipment are supplied. Students just need to bring their own fabric (of natural fibres).

Please wear old clothes or bring an apron to protect your clothes and wear sensible shoes (no open toe shoes).

presentation.dc:title: Introduction to Printing Seamless Repeat Patterns on Textiles

course.dc:description:
You will be required to find a suitable animal-based work placement which you can attend on a regular basis to complete the 300 hours of work experience necessary to undertake this course. You will also need to purchase protective clothing, ordered through the College at a discounted rate.  There are regular trips and visits to animal-based organisations and the approximate cost of a two day visit away is £100.


If you are over 19 year old you will need to pay tuition fees, although there are concessions if this is your first full level 3 qualification, or if you are claiming means-tested benefits.  Please contact our Admissions Office for full details.

This course is for anyone with sound academic ability who wishes to study a vocational qualification, which is mostly theory-based with some practical input.  The course allows you to gain a supervisory level qualification which will enhance your employability in the animal industry.
course.dc:subject: animal zoo animals
course.dc:title: Animal Management City & Guilds Advanced Technical Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome: This qualification is the equivalent of three A-levels and provides a sound entry route to Higher Education.  You may wish to study at Foundation Degree or Degree level and there are a variety of  these Higher Education courses available for progression at Cornwall College Newquay, at Plymouth University and elsewhere at universities out of the county.  Alternatively you may progress into employment within the animal industry with the skills and knowledge to develop working at a supervisory level.
course.mlo:objective:
Attendance is three days per week over two years, during which time you will cover the following subject areas:  animal health; accommodation; feeding; animal handling and safe working; anatomy and physiology; animal biology; research investigation project and work experience.

There are also some optional units which may include:  animal behaviour and communication; welfare and breed development; business management; exotic pet health and husbandry; wildlife management and rehabilitation; animal training; nutrition and zoological animal health and husbandry.

You will be assessed via an ongoing series of written assignments and practical assessments and you will be required to undergo a period of at least 300 hours of work experience, either as day release or in blocks.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have 5 GCSEs at Grade C or above in English, science and maths, a good attendance record at school and demonstrate a sound commitment to working with animals.  You may also be required to provide a reference from your school tutor or from your work place.  You may also progress onto this course with a  Level 2 Diploma in Animal Management (at Merit and Distinction level).  For students aged 19+, your prior experience with animals and academic qualifications will be taken into consideration at interview.

presentation.dc:title: Animal Management City & Guilds Advanced Technical Certificate Level 3

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Make a Silver Bangle and Charm in a day
course.abstract: During this one day jewellery workshop you will leave with a finished item.
course.learningOutcome: You can do one of our other jewellery workshops or try the 10 week Jewellery Making Beginners course.
course.mlo:objective: During these one day workshops you are guaranteed to leave with a finished silver  pendant  to wear yourself or give to someone as a gift.  Throughout the day you will learn basic jewellery techniques, such as piercing (sawing), soldering, texturing, sizing, filing and polishing.  We will be adding textures/patterns by using materials such as, lace, netting, feather, leaves, wallpaper etc. Please bring along of these with you if you have something in particular you would like to try.  You will all be given a suggested list of items to buy for your own jewellery tool kit so that you can continue to create beautiful silver jewellery from home.    This class is a great introduction to working with silver and can be followed by our Jewellery Making Beginners course.

presentation.dc:title: Make a Silver Bangle and Charm in a day

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.
This course is for people who have fire safety responsibilities at work, particularly those tasked with carrying out fire risk assessments and preventing loss of life and property.
course.dc:subject: NEBOSH, Fire Safety, Risk Management, Certificate, nebosh, National, health and safety
Health & Social Care
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Fire Safety and Risk Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome: Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course covers the main legal requirements for safety in the UK as stated in the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order, principles of fire and explosion, causes and prevention of fires, fire protection in buildings and ensuring the safety of people in the event of a fire. Crucially the practical element of the course also ensures that participants can carry out unaided a fire risk assessment and prepare a recommendations report for management.

It is classroom based and involves tutor lead discussions and presentations, group work involving research and feedback, plus individual learning.

You will receive a comprehensive course book which covers the whole syllabus, to aid group work and private study.

Candidates are assessed on completion of the course on dates set nationally by NEBOSH, successful candidates will be awarded with a unit certificate, and a certificate parchment is issued on successful completion of all units including NGC1 of the NEBOSH General Certificate.
course.mlo:prerequisite: To enrol on this course candidates will already have gained a level 2 (or equivalent) award in health and safety.

presentation.dc:subject: Health & Social Care
Business, Administration & Law
presentation.dc:title: Fire Safety and Risk Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3

This two day Adobe Intermediate training course is for anyone wanting to improve their Photoshop skills. It is an intensive tutor led course, delivered by an Adobe Certified tutor which incorporates a substantial amount of hands on training.

The courses are normally delivered at Cornwall College Camborne or St Austell but can be delivered at other locations, including company premises, subject to a viable number of delegates.

course.dc:title: Adobe CS Photoshop (Intermediate)
course.learningOutcome:
Move on to demonstrate that you have the skills needed to get the most out of Adobe software by completing other Intermediate Courses in Photoshop, InDesign, Dreamweaver, Illustrator and also Word Press.

Diversify your digital skills through our suite of Microsoft Office Specialist Courses in Project, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Word and Excel all at introduction and intermediate levels, with Word and Excel at Expert/Advanced Level.
course.mlo:objective:
You will learn how to use Adobe Photoshop to obtain, enhance and present digital images by:

  • Setting Project Requirements
  • Identifying Design Elements When Preparing Images
  • Understanding Adobe Photoshop®
  • Manipulating Images
  • Publishing Digital Images
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal qualifications required for this course, however delegates should have familiarity with the fundamentals of Photoshop and ideally will have previously completed the Introductory course or have similar levels of skills and experience.

course.dc:title: Management and Leadership CMI Award Level 4
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of a Level 4 qualification in Management and Leadership, a number of progression opportunities become available:   

  • Enhance your professional status by upgrading your CMI membership   
  • Progress to other qualifications at the same level (e.g. from Level 4 Award to Level 4 Certificate etc.)   
  • Progress to other qualifications at the next level (e.g. from Level 4 Certificate to Level 5 or 6 Certificate)   
  • Apply to become a Chartered Manager

• Managing stakeholder expectations   
  • Understanding team dynamics   
  • Management report writing   
  • Introducing organisational culture, values and behaviour   
  • Being a leader

course.dc:subject: paranormal research investigations inestigation ghosts spirits scientific psychic haunted researching
Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Paranormal Investigation (JP)
course.abstract: On this course you will gain an understanding of the Paranormal
course.learningOutcome: You could try one of our other leisure courses or workshops.
course.mlo:objective:
On this workshop you will gain an understanding of the Paranormal in the context of Ghosts & Spirits.

You will be introduced to various investigation methods and equipment both from a scientific and psychic perspective.

You will explore the use of different equipment including:  EVP (Electronic Voice Phenomena), Recorders, Ghost/Franks Box, Photography, Trigger Objects, Dowsing Rods, Spirit Boards, Glass Dowsing

You will be encouraged design your own “experiment” to use within a paranormal investigation.

You will be given the opportunity to visit a "Haunted" location and apply the techniques covered in the course.- This will be at a later date and at a small additional cost.

This course is for people at any level in any sector who need an understanding of the essentials of health and safety.

This is a nationally recognised and respected certified training course.
course.dc:subject: Health and Safety, Risk Assessment, Risk management, Health in the work place, IOSH
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Working Safely IOSH Level 1
course.learningOutcome:
In the future, you could progress on to various Health and Safety courses.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course is 1 day and covers the following topics:

  • Introducing working safely
  • Defining hazard and risk
  • Identifying common hazards
  • Improving safety performance
  • Protecting our environment

This course is run as an interactive workshop, with animated graphics, board games and quizzes offering jargon-free technical content based on what people need to know in practice, and does not use off-putting legal language.

Assessment is built into the course through a work scenario risk assessment exercise and multi format written questions.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

presentation.dc:subject: Health & Social Care
presentation.dc:title: Working Safely IOSH Level 1

Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Managing Safely IOSH Certificate
course.mlo:objective:
Tutor lead modules involving interactive presentations games and exercises covering the following topics:

  • Introducing managing safely
  • Assessing the risks
  • Controlling the risks
  • Understanding your responsibilities
  • Identifying hazards
  • Investigating accidents and incidents
  • Measuring performance
  • Protecting our environment

This course concludes with a final assessment on the last day, including a multi-format question paper and a work-based risk assessment.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no entry requirements for this course.

This course is for anyone in middle or top management wishing to develop knowledge and practice their skills in the work environment at a professional level. You should be responsible for developing and instigating new and amended policy and practice to ensure that your organisation complies with its legal obligations, whilst recognising cost and budgetary constraints.
course.dc:subject: occupational, health and safety, occupational health and safety, City & guilds, IOSH
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Occupational Health and Safety CG NVQ Diploma Level 5
course.mlo:objective:
This course is approximately two years and involves practical demonstrations in the workplace where complex health and safety risks occur.

You will be supported by a mentor through a series of work based projects, which are undertaken to demonstrate competence against national standards. You will need to allocate approximately 5 hours per week for research and implementation of improved practice required to gain the qualification.

Your mentor will support you through observations, validation of practice and professional discussions.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have gained an Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH Certificate Level 3 or equivalent to enrol on this course.

presentation.dc:title: Occupational Health and Safety City & Guilds NVQ Diploma Level 5

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.

This course is for anyone in a work environment as it raises learners’ awareness of the concept of risk assessment. 

“Principles of Risk Assessment CIEH Award Level 2” was created in response to industry requirements for all employees to be aware of risks. Although not all employees will be expected to undertake risk assessments themselves, they may be asked to contribute to the process and will be expected to protect their own health and safety and that of others.
course.dc:subject: Principles of Risk Assessment, CIEH, health and safety, first aid, chartered institute of environmental health, CIEH, H&S, award level 2
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Principles of Risk Assessment CIEH Award Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
In the future, you could enrol in the Risk Assessment in Principles and Practice CIEH Award Level 3.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course is run over one day and covers the following modules:

  • Contribution both to the maintenance of a safe work environment and to the process of formal risk assessment
  • The legal requirements for risk assessment
  • The principles of risk assessment including hazards, risks and control measures, 5 steps of risk assessment, the hierarchy of control and risk assessment, review and record keeping

It is run as an interactive workshop, which includes tutor lead sessions, group work exercises and general classroom discussions. You will be assessed by 30 multiple choice question paper.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

This course is for anyone who has, or would like to have health and safety responsibilities within the workplace. For some the NEBOSH Certificate if the first step towards a career as a health and safety professional.
course.dc:subject: Occupational, Health and Safety, NEBOSH, health and safety, National, General Certificate, health & safety, H&S
Health & Social Care
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH National General Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
Upon completion, you will be assessed on dates set nationally by NEBOSH and awarded unit certificates; a certificate parchment is issued on successful completion of all three units.

This course meets the requirements for technical Membership of IOSH (Tech IOSH), and associate membership of International Institute of Risk and Safety Management (IIRSM).

In the future, you could go onto the next level of the Occupational Health and Safety Qualifications.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course covers the following modules:

  • Management of Health and Safety (NGC1)
  • Controlling workplace hazards (NGC2)
  • Health and safety practical application (NGC3)

Modules NGC1 and NGC2 are followed by written exams and NGC3 includes a practical workplace assessment. The course is run over 12 days with 3 block release periods each consisting of 4 days.

“Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH Certificate Level 3” is classroom based and involves tutor lead discussions, presentations, group work involving research and feedback, and individual learning.

There is a comprehensive course book which covers the whole syllabus, to aid group work and private study.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have gained a Health and Safety Award Level 2 or equivalent to enrol on this course.
